text: in writing. \u2012 I supported the recommendation on a draft Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. The Protocol is an addition to the Framework Agreement between the European Union and Lebanon, which I supported, to include the EU Member States that joined after 2004.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. \u2012 We are opposed to the aid of third countries through preferential trade agreements, when the peoples of many of the EU Member States (especially those of southern Europe) live in conditions of economic impoverishment by touching the limits of poverty

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol creates an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, in order to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland , from the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. I voted for it.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. I vote against it: it should be remembered that the EU does not have to have an international role.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 This report - which is not only technical in nature - refers to the inclusion in the Protocol to the EU-Lebanon Euro-Mediterranean Agreement of the 2004 enlargement countries. Lebanon is of strategic importance to the EU in the Middle East on the issue of security and defence. The report notes that the EU wants to protect itself from new threats, such as terrorism. It also needs another country that will be a buffer for more refugees to arrive in Europe. For the EU, there is little need for a collapsing Lebanon. The country has received thousands of refugees, there are problems with the Syrian border, with Israel, with the presence of the self-proclaimed Islamic State. The main objective of the euro-Mediterranean partnership is the economic integration and privileged relationship of these countries with the EU, and is inseparable from objectives of economic dominance and market colonization. The agreement opens the door to free trade agreements. It is part of the EU's political and economic agenda for the Middle East. These are reasons for our opposition.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the draft Council decision on the Euromed agreement on the participation of the Lebanese Republic in Union programmes. Our neighbourhood policy makes it possible to establish privileged relations with the Middle East, increasing bilateral trade that is beneficial to all EU Member States. The European Union is Lebanon's main trading partner, covering about a third of all Lebanese trade, which is why it is necessary to maintain and encourage this partnership, in order to pursue greater economic integration with reciprocal commitments and gains. Furthermore, I believe it is necessary to ratify the protocol that takes account of the enlargement of the European Union in 2004.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. ‒ I abstained. No opinion.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 The main subject of the agreement between the European Union and Lebanon in question is to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am abstaining from this report.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I am opposed to supporting third countries through preferential trade agreements, when the peoples of many of the EU Member States (especially those in southern Europe) live in conditions of economic impoverishment by touching the limits of poverty. So my vote is against.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ Lebanon is a key partner for the EU in the Middle East. The country faces a fragile security environment, being at the forefront of the Syrian civil war, with over a million refugees out of four million of a total of the population. It is in the EU’s interest to foster stability in Lebanon, to develop capabilities and to promote people-to-people contacts and the transfer of expertise. The vote updates the agreement by taking account of the enlargement of the EU. I voted in favour.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 I agree with the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the Republic of Lebanon and the EU, and I therefore voted in favour of it. This gives countries that joined after 2004, including Hungary, the opportunity to accede to the Protocol.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted in favour of the 'Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EU and Lebanon, which takes account of the 2004 enlargement'. It is a technical protocol which stands for good and important cooperation between the EU and the Mediterranean countries.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I am in favour of agreeing to the conclusion of the Minutes. Cooperation between the EU and the Lebanese Republic is important and the conclusion of the Protocol has been made necessary by the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour. It established the partnership between the EU and the Republic of Lebanon as well as took into account the enlargement of the European Union which happened in 2004 when 10 at that time new Member States joined the EU.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: Writing. \u2012 The 3 reports concern the EU-Lebanon cooperation framework and its participation in Union programmes. We have taken a position of abstention, because on the one hand it is the will of the Lebanese authorities, but on the other hand these agreements lead to free trade agreements with all the negative effects they have on the peoples and with which we naturally disagree.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ After having supported the Framework Agreement between the EU and Lebanon, which will allow for greater financial and technical cooperation between the regions, I decided to support this resolution in order to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary , the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia, and the Slovak Republic to the European Union.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this Protocol as I had no problems with the final arrangements.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for engaging more actively with Lebanon, regarding the Council’s decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement, having regard to the 2004 enlargement of the European Union.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the Council's draft decision on the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, in order to take into account the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union, as this gives consent for the conclusion of the agreement. This is a procedure of a technical nature arising from the membership of the abovementioned states in the European Union, which constitutes natural and consistent treatment, and I therefore support this Recommendation.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. These texts are the updating of the Euro-Mediterranean agreements, which are the southern part of the neighbourhood policy. They relate to EU-Lebanon relations for the first and the extension of these to the different incoming countries for the other two. Lebanon is now suffering further destabilization with the mass influx of Syrian refugees (1.5 million) in addition to Palestinian refugees, the bloody incursions of the Islamic State and the ongoing marginalization of the Sunni minority. This country does not need the interference of the European Union as an additional problem. I have taken issue with these three texts relating to the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Union and Lebanon.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which aims to ensure that the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the Union and Lebanon takes into account the accession of the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia.

name: Eva KAILI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for the report of the colleague as I see that cooperation between the regions is of the utmost importance for the well-being of the people and it will only help in the procedure of modernisation and reform of the state.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. In this report, the rapporteur links the migration crisis with the call to strengthen countries to combat the causes of flight. This is a fundamentally sensible idea. However, this assistance should be linked to clear and unambiguous obligations for the readmission of migrants. As this is not the case in the report, I do not agree with it.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. The purpose of this recommendation appears to be to conclude, on behalf of the EU and its Member States, the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the EU and its Member States, on the one hand, and, on the other, to take account of the participation of the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia, in the EU. The protocol in question defines the main aspects for economic, financial and technical cooperation, which ensure the possibility of receiving assistance where necessary. Therefore, in view of parliament's reasons for adopting this recommendation, I support it.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted against the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon. This component takes into account the enlargement of the European Union in 2004. The country of Cedar is now experiencing further destabilization with the mass arrival of Syrian refugees (1.5 million) in addition to Palestinian refugees, the bloody incursions of the Islamic State and the ongoing marginalization of the Sunni minority that does not bode well. It does not need the European Union as an additional problem to meddle in its affairs. The subtlety of the Lebanese political game completely eluding the Community oligarchy, as evidenced by the last session of the Security and Defence Subcommittee. Moreover, it should be remembered that the European Union does not have to have an international role.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. The aim of this report is to integrate the new Member States into the Euro-Mediterranean agreements between the European Union and Lebanon. Although the text is the logical continuity of the integration process, I believe that the EU does not have to replace The Member States in terms of international policy. The country of Cedar is undergoing major destabilization, such as the massive influx of Syrian migrants (1.5 million) in addition to Palestinian refugees and the bloody and unannounced attacks of the Islamic State, and does not need further European interference. I said AGAINST.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The Euro-Mediterranean Agreement (Euromed) promotes the economic integration and reform of 16 neighbouring EU countries in North Africa and the Middle East. This partnership aims at greater economic integration in the region and states that the EU can offer its neighbours a privileged relationship that benefits both sides. Parliament was requested to adopt three mainly technical protocols in order to give its consent for the adoption of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement and to add to the official documents the name of the countries of the 2004 enlargement and Bulgaria and Romania since its integration. I have not been able to vote in favour of this report because such agreements lead to the establishment of free trade agreements which we oppose because of all their disastrous consequences for the majority of the population, but on the other hand I recognise the will of the Lebanese authorities, and respect for the decision of a sovereign country. That's why I voted abstention.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I abstained. I am staying with the accession of the new Member States to the existing agreement.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 Similar to a number of other agreements and protocols, the Protocol for the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EU and Lebanon required it to be adapted to the fact of territorial enlargement of the Union so that cooperation could take place comprehensively and fully between all EU Member States and a third country. In particular, this vote concerned the enlargement of 2004, when 10 countries joined the European Union. Given the specifics of the vote, I have unequivocally voted positively. At the same time, I would like to stress that it is necessary for the relevant vote to take place as soon as possible, also as regards Croatia's accession to the Union in 2013.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the recommendation on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania , the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic because it is not complete and substantiated.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted against these three reports. Three reports are put to the vote of the European Parliament. These texts are a concrete translation of the European Union's Euro-Mediterranean policy. In this case, we oppose any interference in the affairs of the Lebanese state. In addition to the very principle of non-intervention in the internal affairs of a sovereign state, the country is currently experiencing a situation of great instability, due, on the one hand, to the mass immigration of Syrian and Palestinian refugees and, on the other hand, to the recurrent attacks of the Islamic State.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. – Regarding the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EU and Lebanon (2004 enlargement), I voted in favour of it, as the enlargement of the Protocol will certainly benefit all parties. Since 2004, the successful implementation of the Protocol has ensured its necessity and feasibility. The enlargement is a natural consequence and with the accession of more countries, the Protocol’s merit will be enlarged, and will eventually yield benefits to all countries.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. My vote in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing a partnership between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic to the European Union , the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. This concerns the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the EU and its Member States, on the one hand, and Lebanon, on the other. The ENP provides for the gradual opening up of certain Union programmes and bodies to the ENP partner countries. To this end, the Council needs the assent of the European Parliament. On the other hand, this association agreement was not linked to an immigrant/asylum seeker readmission agreement. However, I believe that this would be essential. That is why I voted negatively here.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. Lebanon is now experiencing serious domestic difficulties. In addition to the arrival of 1.5 million Syrian exiles, the number of Palestinian refugees already present is added. I believe that this country does not need in its affairs the European Union, which has no legitimacy in a foreign policy role. Moreover, the Union's very limited understanding of the phenomena occurring in that State lends itself to a justified reservation on this agreement. As a result I voted against it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The purpose of this Protocol is to establish the financial and technical rules enabling the Republic of Lebanon to participate in certain EU programmes. The horizontal framework established by the Protocol defines the principles for economic, financial and technical cooperation and allows the Republic of Lebanon to receive technical assistance, in particular financial assistance, from the European Union in accordance with eu programmes. This framework applies only to programmes whose constitutive legal acts provide for the possibility of participation of the Republic of Lebanon. Therefore, the conclusion of the Protocol does not involve the exercise of powers under the various sectoral policies provided for in the programmes, which are exercised when the programmes are established. It takes into account the 2004 enlargement of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this Protocol which establishes an association between the EU community and the Republic of Lebanon, as a well-defined framework for said association is necessary for both parties to work with each other to achieve goals of development and a more interconnected world.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. I welcome the adoption of the Commission's 2007 legislative proposal for the conclusion of a Euro-Mediterranean protocol between the European Union and its Member States on the one hand and Lebanon on the other. This agreement aims to take into account the accession of the 10 Member States of the 2004 enlargement to the agreement between the European Union and Lebanon.  It is indeed necessary for these Member States to be an integral part of the Euro-Mediterranean agreement in order to facilitate administrative and customs cooperation with Lebanon as much as possible. Moreover, the integration of these Member States into the Euro-Mediterranean Protocol is, in my view, an important step since it will allow the application of the standards for proof of origin conferring preferential tariff treatment on EU-Lebanon trade.  Taking into account the accession of these 10 Member States in this agreement will therefore allow for a standardisation of the rules for the transit of goods travelling between the Union and Lebanon. I therefore welcome the Commission's proposal to include the new Member States in the Euro-Mediterranean agreement in 2004 and I support the conclusion of this agreement on behalf of the European Union.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report because Lebanon is a key partner for the EU in the Middle East. The country faces a fragile security environment, being at the forefront of the Syrian civil war, with over a million refugees out of four million of a total of the population. The EU is interested in fostering stability in Lebanon, developing capabilities and promoting people-to-people contacts and the transfer of expertise. There was broad consensus at committee level on the necessity to engage Lebanon more actively. The vote updates the Agreement by taking account of the enlargement of the EU.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 Following the enlargement of the Union in 2014, the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, took into account the acceding of the Republic of Cyprus, the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Slovak Republic and the Republic of Slovenia to the European Union. The Council adopted a draft decision on the conclusion of the protocol on this, but it must also obtain Parliament's consent to adopt the decision. In its report, the Committee on Foreign Affairs recommends that Parliament agree to the conclusion of the Protocol. I voted accordingly.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 This draft Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, in order to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary , the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union deserves my vote in favour.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. The EU has no international role to play. I am voting against this text.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which proposed the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and the Lebanese Republic. As member countries of the European Union, these states naturally add to the agreement.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 The Protocol annexed to the Convention between the European Union, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, lays down the conditions for the participation of the countries participating in the European Neighbourhood Policy in the programmes offered by the EU. We have accepted that Lebanon should be joining the ranks of the states with which the EU already has such protocols– Armenia, Georgia, Israel, Jordan, Moldova, Morocco and Ukraine. Ten new Member States joined the European Union in 2004, the conclusion of which is self-evident. I therefore support the report, as well as the fact that Slovakia and the other nine Member States should be part of this agreement.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ The European Union aims to establish a common area of peace, stability and shared prosperity in the Euro-Mediterranean region. I voted for this recommendation that will update the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EU and Lebanon by taking into account the enlargement of the EU.

name: Liadh NÍ RIADA
text: in writing. – Similar to the previous framework vote, this vote concerned greater economic integration between the EU and Lebanon in the framework of the European neighbourhood policy. The European neighbourhood policy is aimed at offering its neighbours a privileged relationship. In practice however, this policy has been criticised hugely for its Eurocentricity, hypocritical attitude towards some of the conditionality requirements and damage that can be done to indigenous sectors. This vote was on a legal text to add the names of those countries that joined the EU in the 2004 enlargement to the official documents. As this agreement is foreseen to lead to future trade agreements, I was against it in principle. However, as the Lebanese authorities have taken the decision themselves to enhance cooperation, I abstained on the final vote.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. In principle, the idea of strengthening countries is sensible - but aid must be linked to clear and unambiguous commitments to readmission of migrants, which is not the case here.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. Whereas her colleague's proposal for the conclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, takes account of the accession of several States to the European Union and complies with the provisions of Article 217 and Article 218 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union , I thought it appropriate to vote in favour. I therefore voted in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ Since the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, was signed in 2002, it is also important for member states that, after the signing of this agreement, joined the EU as equal partners, as full members of the EU, and for the benefit of all signatories. The 10 countries that joined the EU in 2004 in the largest enlargement will thus become part of the agreement covering trade in products and striving for further enhanced cooperation in the Mediterranean. Liberalized trade in agricultural products will enable all parties to market their agricultural products in a more efficient and quality way, and this will have a positive impact on the economy of the signatory countries.  The same rules for everyone in competition will provide a fair and level playing field for businesses, while ensuring innovation, uniform standards and small business development. Public procurement also creates opportunities for businesses, boosting private investment and contributing to growth and job creation. Finally, public procurement plays an important role in guiding the ESI Funds. Due to the benefits it brings and the strengthening of THE EU's cooperation with Lebanon, I supported this recommendation on the conclusion of a protocol joined by the 10 members associated with the EU in 2014.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ Lebanon is a key partner for the EU in the Middle East. The country faces a fragile security environment, particularly due to the Syrian war, from more than 1 million refugees to 4 million in total. The EU is interested in fostering stability in Lebanon, developing capabilities and promoting direct contacts and knowledge transfer. I join an already broad consensus at committee level on the need to further engage in efforts to help Lebanon. I also support this report as it is a technical update to the existing treaty which takes into account the 2004 EU enlargement.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this technical adjustment, which allows us to take account of the accession of several states to the European Union in 2004, and thus enable them to be part of the cooperation framework of the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the Union and Lebanon.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this resolution by which the European Parliament grants its approval to the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing a partnership between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Czech Republic , the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic. This agreement, and the two protocols that have been voted on in this plenary session, lay down economic, financial and technical rules to enable Lebanon to participate in certain European Union programmes. The specific terms and conditions for Lebanon's participation in each particular programme shall be determined by the negotiation of agreements between the Commission and the competent authorities in Lebanon.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this recommendation. The aim of the Council's draft decision is to conclude, on behalf of the European Union and its Member States, the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and Lebanon, on the other, to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Czech Republic, Estonia and Cyprus Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 This issue does not require much discussion. In 2004, the enlargement of the European Union and the membership of the 10 new countries in the EU slightly changed our trade agreements with Lebanon. Today, we are simply legitimising the newly created situation. As far as I know, our trading partners are also satisfied with the proposal presented, so I am unequivocally voting in favour of the EU's trade with our important partner Lebanon and the continued free development, thus contributing to the creation of a prosperity and stability zone in the European neighbourhood.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 Following the accession to the European Union in 2004 of the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia, the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an Association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the other part, and Lebanon, of the other part (signed in June 2002) should be updated , luxembourg). This text is only intended to formalise this enlargement process by including the 10 new Member States which joined the European Union in 2004 in the text of the Agreement, and I therefore voted in favour of this draft Council decision.

name: Tokia SAÏFI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which allows the enlargement of the European Union of 2004 to take into account in the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon. With this vote, the European Parliament approves the Council's decision to include the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia in the framework of the European Union's relations with Lebanon.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the recommendation on the conclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement with the Republic of Lebanon, which also takes into account the accession of certain Member States of the European Union. The Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreements are a very important instrument that Europe has used since 1998 to regulate its relations with its neighbours.  These agreements make it possible to regulate the political dialogue between North and South in an appropriate manner, serve as a basis for the progressive liberalisation of trade between the countries concerned and lay down the conditions for cooperation not only economic but also social and cultural cooperation between the parties involved.  The conclusion of this agreement and its extension to EU countries that had not yet acceded to it will contribute to the promotion of a fruitful and lasting dialogue with Lebanon, a country strongly affected by the migration crisis triggered by the war in neighbouring Syria.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU

name: Sven SCHULZE
text: Writing. I voted in favour of the 'Recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other, on the occasion of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union'. , as monitoring our own progress and making improvements in this regard is an important task for the EU.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The Euro-Mediterranean Agreement (Euromed) promotes the economic integration and reform of 16 neighbouring EU countries in North Africa and the Middle East. This partnership aims at greater economic integration in the region and states that the EU can offer its neighbours a privileged relationship that benefits both sides. Parliament was requested to adopt three mainly technical protocols in order to give its consent for the adoption of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement and to add to the official documents the name of the countries of the 2004 enlargement and Bulgaria and Romania since its integration. I voted against this report because these types of agreements lead to the establishment of free trade agreements which we oppose because of all their disastrous consequences for the popular classes of the countries and States concerned.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The Protocol on the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement takes into account the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, Hungary, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. Since I think it is important for all current Members to sign this protocol, I have decided to vote in favour.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this resolution. This Protocol seeks to define financial and technical rules enabling Lebanon to participate in certain EU programmes. This resolution concerning the Protocol is about taking into account the accession of certain countries to the European Union, including the Slovak Republic in 2004.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the EU-Lebanon Euro-Mediterranean Agreement, as it is mainly about clarifying the technical and financial rules relating to Lebanon's participation in Union programmes. The agreement is part of the European Neighbourhood Policy (ENP), which allows partner countries access to EU programmes and agencies. This is one of the instruments by which the EU supports reforms and modernisation in its neighbourhood. Similar agreements have been negotiated with several countries since 2007, and so far protocols have been signed with Armenia, Georgia, Israel, Jordan, Moldova, Morocco and Ukraine. Lebanon expressed its interest in acceding to these programmes in 2013. Lebanon will thus have access to technical and financial assistance, which should enable the country to improve its public policies. As Lebanon is currently mired in instability in its region, an agreement with the EU could bring the support the country needs. I also agreed to extend this Protocol to countries that joined the EU in 2004.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: Writing. \u2012 EU enlargement needs to be updated and therefore the accession of 2004 countries needs to be clearly taken into account.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ I supported the conclusion of the agreement taking into account the draft Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, in order to take into account the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. As these Member States became Members in 2004, I support the conclusion of this Agreement.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒ The European Parliament has given its consent to the conclusion of the agreement taking into account the draft Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, in order to take into account the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. I support the conclusion of this Agreement, as I consider that such a thing naturally stems from the fact that these are Member States of the European Union.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \ I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreementing with an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Lebanese Republic, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. This approval of the Protocol, which is primarily of a technical nature, brings with the inclusion of the remaining countries that joined the European Union in 2004 and were not parties to the original agreement.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: Writing. \u2012 Agreements between the EU and third countries should be sought that promote the development of the Member States of the European Union and without prejudice to their national and economic interests.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the proposal for a supplementary protocol to modernise the legal basis of the previous agreement between the European Communities and Lebanon and to adapt to the circumstances of the enlarged EU. I consider it all the more appropriate to settle the legal basis for relations between the EU and its Member States and Lebanon, because Lebanon has recently assumed extraordinary burdens in dealing with the migration wave to Europe and the refugee crisis and has become a key partner of the EU in the region.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Council's draft decision on the conclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, to take into account the accession to the European Union of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Latvia , the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ The Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishes an association between the EU, its Member States and Lebanon, and aims to define the financial and technical rules permitting Lebanon to participate in certain EU programmes. I voted in favour of the Protocol’s recognition of the accession of the countries that joined the EU in 2004, namely the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia. Only by involving all the members of the EU in this cooperation can we ensure that these efforts will positively affect the lives of both Lebanese and Europeans.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. On 10 February 2004, on behalf of the European Community and its Member States, the Council authorised the Commission to open negotiations with the Lebanese Republic with a view to adapting the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other, in order to take account of the accession of the new Member States to the European Union.  Since the negotiations were completed to the satisfaction of the Commission, I supported the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, in order to take into account the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic of the European Union.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. The purpose of the Council Decision is to conclude, on behalf of the European Union and its Member States, a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Partnership and Cooperation Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, taking into account the accession of the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia to the European Union. I therefore supported the recommendation on the Council decision on the conclusion of the said Protocol.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. I voted against this protocol because the European Union does not have to have an international role, and because the intricacies of the Lebanese political game are completely beyond the community oligarchy.

name: István UJHELYI
text: Writing. \u2012 This document concerns the draft Protocol annexed to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Cyprus, the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Slovak Republic and the Republic of Slovenia to the European Union. I voted in favour.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU.

name: Viktor USPASKICH
text: Writing. – I support this proposal.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an Association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus , the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia, and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. The objective of the Protocol is to lay down the financial and technical rules enabling the Republic of Lebanon to participate in certain EU programmes. I believe that the participation of the 2004 enlargement countries in this Agreement is a natural consequence of their EU accession.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. This protocol incorporates the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia by the EU into the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon. That is why I believe it is necessary to vote in favour of this decision.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: in writing. The Euro-Mediterranean Agreement (Euromed) promotes the economic integration and reform of 16 neighbouring EU countries in North Africa and the Middle East. This partnership aims at greater economic integration in the region and states that the EU can offer its neighbours a privileged relationship that benefits both sides. Parliament was requested to adopt three mainly technical protocols in order to give its consent for the adoption of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement and to add to the official documents the name of the countries of the 2004 enlargement and Bulgaria and Romania since its integration. I have not been able to vote in favour of this report because such agreements lead to the establishment of free trade agreements which we oppose because of all their disastrous consequences for the majority of the population, but on the other hand I recognise the will of the Lebanese authorities, and respect for the decision of a sovereign country. That's why I voted abstention.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. 'Following the enlargement of the EU to include the 10 Member States with the 10 Member States, the Protocol with Lebanon also had to include these ten Member States as signatorys; I therefore agreed to this too.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. Thematic issue is the framework agreement between the European Union and the Lebanese Republic on the general principles for the participation of the Lebanese Republic in Union programmes. In particular, the recommendation deals with enlargement to the Member States that joined in 2004. It is also a question of combating the causes of flight on the ground, an effort which I certainly support. However, if, as here, concessions are made by the EU without being bound by obligations to take back illegal migrants, then I consider this to be irresponsible.

name: Theodoros ZAGORAKIS
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 I supported this initiative, the content of which has been adopted by the committee responsible and concerns Euro-Mediterranean cooperation between Lebanon and the Member States that joined the EU with the 2004 enlargement.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. \ I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreementing with an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Lebanese Republic, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union. The approval of the Protocol allows accession to the Eu-Lebanon Euro-Mediterranean Agreement by states which joined the European Union in 2004 and were not parties to the original agreement.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing. \u2012 The implementation of a Euro-Mediterranean agreement to promote neighbourhood policies is a priority for the European Union. Strengthening not only economic and trade relations, but the stability and security of some neighbouring states themselves, will make it possible to extend the scope of European objectives and strategies. The resolution before us aims to take account, in the context of lebanon's accession process, of the future association with the European Union of the Republics of Bulgaria and Romania. I therefore voted in favour because I believe that cooperation between the EU and these states will be able to extend the application of European safeguards and guarantees, especially in the areas of democracy, the rule of law and human rights.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The Euro-Mediterranean Agreement (Euromed) promotes the economic integration and reform of 16 neighbouring EU countries in North Africa and the Middle East. This partnership aims at greater economic integration in the region and states that the EU can offer its neighbours a privileged relationship that benefits both sides. Parliament was requested to adopt three mainly technical protocols in order to give its consent for the adoption of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement and to add to the official documents the name of the countries of the 2004 enlargement and Bulgaria and Romania since its integration. I have not been able to vote in favour of this report because such agreements lead to the establishment of free trade agreements which we oppose because of all their disastrous consequences for the majority of the population, but on the other hand I recognise the will of the Lebanese authorities, and respect for the decision of a sovereign country. That's why I voted abstention.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: In writing. These texts deal with the updating of the Euro-Mediterranean agreements, which are the southern part of the neighbourhood policy. They concern relations between the EU and Lebanon for the first and enlargement to the different incoming countries for the other two. I voted against these texts, which constitute interference by the European Union in the affairs of a state already facing the massive influx of refugees, the bloody incursions of the Islamic State or the ongoing marginalization of the country's Sunni minority. The EU has no international role to play.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. ‒ This particular vote was on a legal text to add the names of Bulgaria and Romania, who joined the EU in 2009, to the official documents. I had concerns with this report as one of its aims is to increase economic integration between the EU and Lebanon in the framework of the European Neighbourhood Policy. In practice however, this policy has been criticised hugely for its eurocentricity, hypocritical attitude towards some of the conditionality requirements and damage that can be done to indigenous sectors. However, as Lebanese authorities have taken the decision themselves to enhance cooperation, I abstained on the final vote.

name: Eric ANDRIEU
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this recommendation. The European Union has strategic relations with Lebanon. We support the stability of this country and its security in a region of the world in the midst of severe turbulence. Lebanon's participation in EU programmes is a way to concretely support these strategic objectives.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 This Recommendation, which I voted in favour of, concerns the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania. We await its notification to the relevant institutions and governments.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. The proposed text is an update of the Euro-Mediterranean agreements. It concerns EU-Lebanon relations for the first and the extension of these to the different incoming countries for the other two. Lebanon is now experiencing further destabilization with the mass influx of Syrian refugees (1.5 million) in addition to Palestinian refugees. It does not need the European Union as an additional problem to meddle in its affairs. The subtlety of the Lebanese political game completely escaped the Community oligarchy, I voted against the protocol.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. This agreement, updating the southern part of the neighbourhood policy, concerns the enlargement of EU-Lebanon relations to the various countries that have recently entered this straitjacket. I voted against this text, believing that there is no reason for the Union to dictate their foreign policy to the Member States. Moreover, I cannot accept that an agreement whose harmful effects I denounce for both Lebanon and my country should be extended to other countries.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I voted for this protocol to include Bulgaria and Romania in the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon. As full members of the Union, it makes sense for Bulgaria and Romania to join this agreement.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the Mănescu report approving a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community, with its Member States, and the Lebanese Republic. This is an important text that allows us to take into account the 2007 enlargement of the EU that led to the accession of Romania and Bulgaria to the Union. The agreement strengthens the neighbourhood policy, responding to two requirements: on the one hand, the 2013 request of the Middle East state to have closer links with the Union will be met, and on the other hand the reform processes and stability of a country that, occupying a strategic position in an area extremely at risk, represents a fundamental ally in the fight against Daesh and Islamic terrorism.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. This recommendation relates to the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon following the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU in 2007.  As with the previous recommendation, the EU has no international role to play and foreign policy must be the responsibility of states. Lebanon does not need European interference in its national problems. So I voted against it.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 There are still passages in this text that I do not agree with and that have pushed me towards a vote of abstention.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this resolution by which the European Parliament grants its approval to the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an Association between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Lebanese Republic, on the other hand, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. This agreement, and the two protocols that have been voted on in this plenary session, lay down economic, financial and technical rules to enable Lebanon to participate in certain European Union programmes. The specific terms and conditions for Lebanon's participation in each particular programme shall be determined by the negotiation of agreements between the Commission and the competent authorities in Lebanon.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it approves on behalf of the European Union and its Member States the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the Union.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: Writing. \u2012 The enlargement of the European Union requires that the agreements in force reflect the real situation, so I voted in favour of the adoption of the amendment.

name: Marie-Christine BOUTONNET
text: In writing. Lebanon does not need the EU to meddle in its affairs; it has enough problems related to the mass influx of Syrian refugees in addition to Palestinian refugees.   Added to this is that the EU does not have to have an international role. Therefore, I voted against it.

name: Lynn BOYLAN
text: in writing. – This particular vote was on a legal text to add the names of Bulgaria and Romania, who joined the EU in 2009, to the official documents. I had concerns with this report as one of its aims is to increase economic integration between the EU and Lebanon in the framework of the European Neighbourhood Policy. In practice however, this policy has been criticised hugely for its eurocentricity, hypocritical attitude towards some of the conditionality requirements and damage that can be done to indigenous sectors. However, as Lebanese authorities have taken the decision themselves to enhance cooperation, I abstained on the final vote.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing. \u2012 It is right that the Republic of Bulgaria and the Republic of Romania, now that they are fully part of the European Union, should also participate in the global partnership and/or cooperation agreements that the EU signs with foreign states. We consider this to be a due act.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. This report aims to update the Euro-Mediterranean agreements, ratified within the framework of the European Union's neighbourhood policy. Lebanon is currently plagued by serious internal unrest, particularly as a result of the massive influx of Syrian migrants in addition to Palestinian refugees. The country of Cedar is also suffering from the bloody incursions of the Islamic State. However, the European Union has demonstrated in the past that it has no legitimacy and credibility to interfere in internal affairs in a third country. On the one hand, the Union must respect the principle of non-interference; on the other hand, foreign policy remains an exclusive competence of the Member States. That is why I objected to this text.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 The involvement of partner countries in the European Neighbourhood Policy is also transposed through various agreements—key. The Lebanese Republic's interest in participating in Union programmes and agencies open to partner states in the European Neighbourhood Policy has materialised through a protocol with standard provisions containing an agreement—framework on the general principles of Lebanon's participation. The Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Lebanese Republic, of the other part, on a framework agreement between the European Union and the Lebanese Republic on the general principles of the Lebanese Republic's participation in Union programmes, aims to establish financial and technical rules, and at the same time , measures of economic, financial, technical cooperation. This report aims to take into account the accession of Romania and Bulgaria to the Union. I consider it essential to participate equally and to provide fair premises for involvement in the actions of the Union of all Member States, which is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of this recommendation because I believe it is necessary, following the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union, to adopt the adaptation to the Association Agreement between the EU and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Lebanon on the other. On 23 October 2006, the Council authorised the Commission, on behalf of the European Community and its Member States, to negotiate protocols amending the agreements concluded between the European Community and its Member States and third countries, including the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement in question. The negotiations were, however, delayed by the difficulties encountered by the Lebanese Government and by the fact that, before giving its agreement in principle to the text, the latter requested clarifications outside the scope of the Protocol.  During these negotiations it was decided not to add to the existing Association Agreement any further trade concessions in the fields of agriculture, processed agricultural products and fishery products.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ Similar to the previous framework vote, this vote concerned greater economic integration between the EU and Lebanon in the framework of the European Neighbourhood Policy. The European Neighbourhood Policy which is aimed at offering its neighbours a privileged relationship. In practice however, this policy has been criticised hugely for its eurocentricity, hypocritical attitude towards some of the conditionality requirements and damage that can be done to indigenous sectors. This particular vote was on a legal text to add the names of Bulgaria and Romania, who joined the EU in 2009, to the official documents. As Lebanese authorities have taken the decision themselves to enhance cooperation, I abstained on the final vote.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I gave my consent to the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Lebanon on the principles and standards for the participation of Lebanon in certain EU programmes. The purpose is to include Bulgaria and Romania in the agreement given their accession into the European Union. They will certainly benefit from further cooperation and strengthened partnership with Lebanon.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the agreement and consider the results of the negotiations between the Commission and the Republic of Lebanon to be satisfactory.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted on the recommendation concerning the conclusion of an Association Protocol between the European Community and the Republic of Lebanon to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania. This debate is part of wider EU cooperation with the Lebanese State and as it is primarily aimed at economic issues, I do not think it has the interests of citizens at the forefront. That is why I abstained.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I am in favour of this proposal which represents only the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the agreement concluded between the European Union and Lebanon when the two countries were still not part of the European Union. I think it is appropriate that the countries mentioned above, since they have joined the Union, should also accede to the agreements it has concluded with third countries. That is why I have chosen to vote in favour of the proposal.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this Protocol, which is to have the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an Association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, approved on behalf of the Union and its Member States to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the Union.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The Euro-Mediterranean Agreement (Euromed) promotes the economic integration and reform of 16 neighbouring EU countries in North Africa and the Middle East. This partnership aims at greater economic integration in the region and states that the EU can offer its neighbours a privileged relationship that benefits both sides. Parliament was requested to adopt three mainly technical protocols in order to give its consent for the adoption of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement and to add to the official documents the name of the countries of the 2004 enlargement and Bulgaria and Romania since its integration. I have not been able to vote in favour of this report because such agreements lead to the establishment of free trade agreements which we oppose because of all their disastrous consequences for the majority of the population, but on the other hand I recognise the will of the Lebanese authorities, and respect for the decision of a sovereign country. That's why I voted abstention.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing. \u2012 Taking into account the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU, the European Parliament adopted a legislative resolution on the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Community and the Member States and the Lebanese Republic. I voted in favour of this resolution, confirming my support for the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the EU and Lebanon, as part of a framework agreement between the European Union and the Lebanese Republic on the participation of the Lebanese Republic in EU programmes.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: in writing. \u2012 The Lebanese Republic is a true cultural, ethnic and religious mosaic, with a population of about 4.5 million, which manages to be a model of respect for diversity, tolerance and stability. Through its participation in the European Neighbourhood Policy, the Lebanese Republic has succeeded in implementing a significant number of reforms with a view to democratising, strengthening the rule of law and protecting the fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens. The Lebanese Republic is also an important strategic partner in the areas of mobility, migration and security, as it shares a large proportion of the vulnerabilities and threats that characterise today's southern flank of the Union. An example of this strong partnership is the working and documentaries visit to the border management of senior Lebanese officials in October 2015 in Romania under the European Union Integrated Border Management programme. I voted in favour of this recommendation, wishing to reiterate the importance of deepening economic, political and cultural cooperation between the European states and the Lebanese Republic.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 Recommendation on a draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. The EU's European Neighbourhood Policy offers its neighbours the opportunity to enter into privileged bilateral relations based on mutual attachment to common values such as democracy and human rights, the rule of law, the principles of good governance, market economy law and sustainable development. In order to maintain the above-mentioned relations in Bulgaria and Romania, I voted in favour of this proposal.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of giving consent to the conclusion of the Protocol to include Bulgaria and Romania in the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Union and Lebanon. I believe that the aim of the European Neighbourhood policy to achieve political and economic integration with the southern and eastern countries is extremely important.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This report is a recommendation of the European Parliament on the Council's plan to conclude the Euro-Mediterranean agreement establishing an association between the EU and the Lebanese Republic. This protocol aims to take into account the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. Considering that the European Union's cooperation with Lebanon is indispensable and that the enlargement of 2007 should be taken into account, I supported this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. I supported the conclusion of the Protocol of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Union and Lebanon, taking into account the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. Having joined the European Union in 2007, Bulgaria and Romania must be included in the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Lebanon.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. This text on EU-Lebanon relations contributes to the updating of the Euro-Mediterranean agreements. These are the southern part of neighbourhood policy. Lebanon is destabilized by the arrival of about 1.5 million Syrian refugees in addition to Palestinian refugees. Added to this are the bloody incursions of the jihadists of the Islamic State group. Not only does the complexity of Lebanese issues and the political context of that country seem to escape the European oligarchy, but it should be remembered that the EU is not intended to play a role on the international stage. For these reasons, I voted against this text.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. The Framework Agreement creates a favourable climate for economic links between the European Union and Lebanon, in particular in the area of trade and investment. Of particular importance for the implementation of the Framework Agreement and the achievement of the objectives set out therein is the inclusion of all full members of the European Union, including Bulgaria and Romania.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. \u2012 We are opposed to the aid of third countries through preferential trade agreements, when the peoples of many of the EU Member States (especially those of southern Europe) live in conditions of economic impoverishment by touching the limits of poverty

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 This Protocol to the Mediterranean Euro Agreement creates an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. I voted for it.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. Vote against: it should be remembered that the EU does not have to have an international role.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 This report - which is not only technical in nature - refers to the inclusion in the Protocol to the EU-Lebanon Euro-Mediterranean Agreement of Bulgaria and Romania (2007 enlargement). Lebanon is of strategic importance to the EU in the Middle East on the issue of security and defence. The report notes that the EU wants to protect itself from new threats, such as terrorism. It also needs another country that will be a buffer for more refugees to arrive in Europe. For the EU, there is little need for a collapsing Lebanon. The country has received thousands of refugees, there are problems with the Syrian border, with Israel, with the presence of the self-proclaimed Islamic State. The main objective of the euro-Mediterranean partnership is the economic integration and privileged relationship of these countries with the EU, and is inseparable from objectives of economic dominance and market colonization. The agreement opens the door to free trade agreements. It is part of the EU's political and economic agenda for the Middle East. These are reasons for our opposition.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the draft Council decision on the Euromed agreement on the participation of the Lebanese Republic in Union programmes. Our neighbourhood policy makes it possible to establish privileged relations with the Middle East, increasing bilateral trade that is beneficial to all EU Member States. The European Union is Lebanon's main trading partner, covering about a third of all Lebanese trade, which is why it is necessary to maintain and encourage this partnership, in order to pursue greater economic integration with reciprocal commitments and gains. Furthermore, I believe it is necessary to ratify the protocol that takes account of the enlargement of the European Union in 2007, with the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. ‒ I abstained. No opinion.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 The main subject of the agreement in question between the European Union and Lebanon is to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am abstaining from this report.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I am opposed to supporting third countries through preferential trade agreements, when the peoples of many of the EU Member States (especially those in southern Europe) live in conditions of economic impoverishment by touching the limits of poverty. So my vote is against.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ Lebanon is a key partner for the EU in the Middle East. The country faces a fragile security environment, being at the forefront of the Syrian civil war, with over a million of refugees out of 4 million total population. It is in the EU’s interest to foster stability in Lebanon, to develop capabilities and to promote people-to-people contacts and the transfer of expertise. The vote updates the agreement by taking account of the enlargement of the EU. I voted in favour.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 I agree with the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the Republic of Lebanon and the EU, and I therefore voted in favour of it. This gives countries that joined after 2004, including Hungary, the opportunity to accede to the Protocol.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted in favour of this mainly technical protocol, as it represents good and important cooperation between the EU and the Mediterranean countries.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I am in favour of agreeing to the conclusion of the Minutes. Cooperation between the EU and the Lebanese Republic is important and the conclusion of the Protocol was made necessary by the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. U2012 We abstain in this vote by considering that, while such agreements seek to advance eminently economic-commercial integration that excludes fundamental dimensions of integration (such as respect for human rights in general and labour and women's rights in particular, free human mobility, recognition of academic qualifications, the treatment of environmental issues of common interest , and others), it is the citizens of the States that must choose the type and degree of partnership they wish to maintain with the EU.

name: Beata GOSIEWSKA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 On the draft Council Decision on the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Lebanon, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. I support the Association Protocol between the European Union and the Republic of Lebanon. Lebanon is a Member State of the Euro-Mediterranean Partnership that supports economic integration and democratic reforms in the European Union's southern neighbouring countries. Bilateral trade with Lebanon continues to grow and the EU market accounts for a third of all Lebanese trade.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour. The agreement established partnership between the EU and the Republic of Lebanon and highlighted the accession of Bulgaria and Romania in the EU.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: Writing. \u2012 The 3 reports concern the EU-Lebanon cooperation framework and its participation in Union programmes. We have taken a position of abstention, because on the one hand it is the will of the Lebanese authorities, but on the other hand these agreements lead to free trade agreements with all the negative effects they have on the peoples and with which we naturally disagree.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this recommendation, as did the majority of the Parliament.
