I abstained in the final vote of the joint resolution mainly because it does not recognize genocide, calls for the reinforcement of MOUNSCO and in particular through patrols and mobile operations bases, even if some paragraphs with which I agree call for an assessment, and does not reflect information on the responsibilities of multinationals in the financial support of conflict and the illegal exploitation of natural resources.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 Although the war has officially ended in Congo, there are still armed rebel groups operating there, which, like government troops, are committing heinous crimes against the civilian population. He regrets that the government is under-suppressing rebel forces terrorising the population. I have long been concerned about Congo's lack of infrastructure and, despite its huge reserves of precious metals and minerals, the dire economic situation of the majority of the population. It is equally concerned about the situation of guaranteeing fundamental human rights and freedoms, which is one of the fundamental features of each country's democracy. Unfortunately, despite the efforts of international organisations active in the field of the protection of human rights, we can see signs of violations of fundamental human rights and freedoms in congo, in the form of racism, discrimination against a particular race, religion or sex. These violations are evidenced by the fact that some 1.7 million people have fled their homes from congo because of killings, robberies, brutal sexual violence against women and girls, and almost 500 000 have fled abroad for these reasons. I condemn all the violence that is happening in the Congo, and I believe that the competent authorities and institutions will do their best to stop crimes committed at the expense of the civilian population.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: Writing. More than 600 civilians have been brutally killed with machete, axes and knives, including women, children and even babies, in the area around the town of Beni in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo since 2014. At the same time, armed groups not only used sexual violence as a weapon of war, but also recruited child soldiers. The great inability to bring human rights violators to justice has resulted in a great deal of impunity and new crimes. The fighting in eastern Congo stems from several sources, including ethnic conflict, political discontent and regional geopolitics. This unreliable mix is exacerbated by resource shortages in the impoverished region. In view of all the above, meps of the European Parliament have decided to adopt a resolution condemning the continued attacks by armed groups and the carrying out of extreme violence against the people of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the eastern provinces, and called on all relevant authorities to take immediate action to bring the offenders to justice. The resolution calls on the ICC prosecutor to gather information and examine abuses in order to determine whether an ICC investigation into alleged crimes in the beni area is necessary. For all these reasons, I believe that the resolution is welcome and I supported it.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: Writing. \u2012 Following the terrible events in Congo, where innocent human lives have been lost and thousands of people have lost their homes, we must take a clear stance and help solve the problems caused by the disaster of the people affected in eastern Congo.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ Congo's incessing humanitarian and military crisis has caused the deaths of some 5 million people, and the security situation, as well as the human rights situation in the eastern part of the state, is still deteriorating. Armed groups are still active, and reports of violations of human rights and international humanitarian law, such as targeted attacks on civilians and systematic exploitation of children by armed groups, do not stop coming. Foreign and domestic armed groups, including the FARDC (DRC Armed Forces), continue to attack civilians, often on ethical grounds. It is inadmissible to violate human rights, commit war crimes and crimes against humanity.  It is therefore necessary for the Congo authorities and international partners to conduct thorough, independent and transparent research and to try to create and maintain peace and stability by neutralising armed groups in the region. I also believe that the European Union should make a detailed evaluation of the humanitarian situation in congo, warn the international community about massacres and provide assistance to save lives and improve living conditions for the most vulnerable groups in congo. I believe the situation in congo is worrying and therefore I support this report.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒ The humanitarian and military crisis in Congo has so far caused the deaths of over 5 million people. There are continuing reports of violations of human rights and international humanitarian law, especially in the east of the country. The European Parliament expressed deep concern for such violations, especially attacks on civilians by armed groups. Parliament calls for the intervention of international organisations, in particular the African and European Union as well as neighbouring Congo countries, to ensure political dialogue between all stakeholders, to prevent further destabilisation, to encourage progress in the implementation of peace, security, cooperation frameworks. It calls on the Union to send an observer to assess the situation and warn the international community about the massacres committed. I support the proposal for this Resolution because I believe it can achieve some progress in terms of security and human rights protection in the State of Congo and prevent targeted attacks against civilians, increasing sexual violence and systematic recruitment and use of children by armed groups.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \ I voted in favour of the joint motion for a resolution on the massacres in eastern Congo. I support the call in the resolution for all parties to the conflict to end the violence immediately, to lay down their arms and release all children from their ranks, while at the same time promoting dialogue for a peaceful and lasting solution to the conflict. More recently, the security and human rights situation in Congo has continued to deteriorate due to the actions of dozens of armed groups. The government of the Democratic Republic of Congo should be a priority for the disarmament of armed groups and the establishment of lasting security and peace for all citizens.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Events taking place in the Democratic Republic of the Congo are reprehensible. But the EU must not be involved in the internal affairs of other countries.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the adoption of parliament's resolution, trusting that the European Parliament would draw attention to a widespread violence and mass human rights violations that the international community has been unable to act effectively against for almost two decades. I find it particularly worrying and unacceptable that irregular armed militias of different compositions operating along the country's eastern border regularly and specifically commit violence against women and children and often recruit minor children to fight and commit murder. I therefore support the demand, also made in the resolution, that the international community, even at UNSC level, act much more decisively than before in order to stop the acts of violence and to punish those responsible for it.  I agree that the European Union should lead this effort, send a special observer to the region and initiate specific international sanctions against the perpetrators, in line with our common foreign policy objectives and European human rights principles in relation to Africa.

name: Adam SZEJNFELD
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The continuing humanitarian and military crisis in Congo has already killed some 5 million people and the security and human rights situation continues to deteriorate, particularly in the eastern part of the country. Unfortunately, despite numerous atrocities by both the rebels and the state armed forces, President Kabili remains insensitive to the appeals of the international community. As a result, the country is on the verge of collapse and more than 7 million people are in need of immediate humanitarian assistance. In its resolution, in addition to assessing the current situation in Congo, the European Parliament called on the parties to the conflict to immediately cease violence, lay down arms, release children from service in the ranks and promote dialogue for a peaceful and lasting solution to the conflict. In addition, the document highlights the Congolese Government's obligation to guarantee security throughout the country and to ensure the protection of its citizens. In its resolution, Parliament also called on the Union and its Member States to continue to provide assistance to the people of Congo in order to protect against death and improve the living conditions of vulnerable groups of the population. I believe that Parliament's resolution gives an important and unequivocal message that the situation in Congo must improve and that the authorities start taking responsibility for the fate of their own citizens, which is why I decided to vote in favour of the resolution.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union attaches greater importance to relations with African states in order to support the strengthening of democracy, economic development and social conditions in this part of the world. In this respect, a very good relationship has been developed with the Democratic Republic of the Congo, a country affected by military and civil conflicts in recent decades. Currently, a number of armed rebel groups are active in the eastern part of the country, which manifests itself violently through the massacre of civilians and the kidnapping of humanitarian activists, promoting ethnic cleansing, illegal diamond trafficking, secession of certain regions. The EU has been actively involved in humanitarian assistance for the population of the region and in supporting the country's armed forces through the UN Stabilisation Mission in the DRC (MONUSCO). However, the efforts to date have not led to the remediation of the situation on the ground. At the same time, the government has taken a number of reprehensible measures against political opposition leaders, which are likely to discredit the democratic system among local populations. This resolution supports greater involvement of the EU institutions, in cooperation with the authorities of DR Congo, to address internal problems and strengthen democracy and the rule of law in that country. I support the adoption of these necessary documents.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. The current situation should not prevent constitutionally compliant elections, nor the DRC government and Monusco from investigating the inability of Congolese forces and Monusco to protect civilians in the Beni region. The international community must open a rigorous, independent and transparent investigation into the massacres. We call for the group of envoys and international representatives for the Great Lakes region of Africa on elections in the Democratic Republic of Congo to meet urgently to take appropriate measures in this regard, such as the mobilization of the United Nations Security Council.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the resolution stating that the massacres carried out in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) amid general indifference have to stop and those responsible for the atrocities brought to justice. Indeed, I am deeply concerned by the continuing deterioration in the security and humanitarian situation in the country in this pre-election period which has seen an escalation in the violence. It is now high time that all parties to the conflict to put an end to the violence, lay down their arms, and release all children from their ranks. I also call for quick and active resumption of collaboration between MONUSCO and the RDC armed forces, on the basis of the military cooperation agreement signed on 28 January.  In order to ensure the future and reconciliation in DRC I call with my colleagues from the European parliament for a thorough, independent and transparent investigation to be launched by the international community into the massacres, with the full collaboration of the DRC Government and MONUSCO.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. Between October 2014 and May 2016, 1,116 people died as a result of violence in the East Congo. The situation in eastern Congo in terms of security and human rights is very alarming, the attacks on the civilian population are continuous while the perpetrators of human rights violations go unpunished. There is also widespread discontent among the population over President Kabila's failure to take any measures on the issue of punishing perpetrators.  I believe that those responsible for human rights violations and violations, child abductions, sexual violence against women and children must be detained and held accountable. In addition, the Government of the Republic of Congo must guarantee the protection of its citizens in order to put an end to the conflicts. I also hope that the European Union's dialogue with the Republic of Congo will be stepped up to save lives and improve living conditions for the most vulnerable population groups.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. - I supported the motion for a resolution on the massacres in eastern Congo. In the area around the city of Beni in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo, more than 600 civilians have been brutally killed with machete, axes and knives, including women, children and even babies, since 2014. These poasings are the worst violence in the country in a decade, and neither the Congolese authorities nor the MONUSCO mission have carried out a formal investigation into it. In more than a decade of conflict in eastern Congo, civilians have been systematically attacked by a number of armed groups. They used sexual violence as a weapon of war and recruited child soldiers. The great inability to bring human rights violators to justice has resulted in a great deal of impunity and new crimes. The fighting in eastern Congo stems from several sources, including ethnic conflict, political discontent and regional geopolitics, and this unreliable mix is exacerbated by resource shortages in the impoverished region. Unofficial or artisanal mining accounts for almost a fifth of the country's economic output and employs one million Congolese people, while also providing a source of profit for rebels and corrupt government soldiers, as well as traders from neighbouring countries who trade directly or through local armed allies. The provision of peace is hampered by the Democratic Republic of Congo's unsuccessful efforts to demobilise thousands of rebel fighters, either by joining the national army or by helping them integrate into civilian life.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. U2012 We voted to abstain in this resolution because despite condemning recent dramatic events in the Democratic Republic of the Congo it can be considered partial by not addressing the root causes of the current situation of instability, namely the inequality and role of large extractive transnationals in the territory

name: Ramon TREMOSA i BALCELLS
text: in writing. ‒ I fully support this resolution as I strongly condemn what is happening in Eastern Congo. I call as a matter of urgency for a thorough, independent and transparent investigation to be launched by the international community into the massacres, with the full collaboration of the DRC Government and MONUSCO. With this vote we ask for an emergency meeting of the Team of International Envoys and Representatives for the Great Lakes region of Africa on elections in the DRC with a view to taking appropriate action in this direction, such as mobilising the UN Security Council. I insist that this situation should not prevent elections from taking place as constitutionally planned.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. The proposed resolutions are marked by a clear ignorance of what is happening in Congo. Indeed, to understand the situation of Great Lakes Africa, we must refer to the end of the Cold War and the American decision to reinvest this region at the expense of France with the support of Canadian, British and Israeli diplomats.  It is in this context that we must first understand the Rwandan crisis and then the use of Rwanda and Uganda to destabilize the DRC today on the basis of ethnic divides.  I vote AGAINST all resolutions, except that of the GUE, which seems to be the best studied.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. U2012 We voted to abstain in this resolution because despite condemning recent dramatic events in the Democratic Republic of the Congo it can be considered partial by not addressing the root causes of the current situation of instability, namely the inequality and role of large extractive transnationals in the territory.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the resolutions on massacres in eastern Congo.  The resolution recalls the commitment made by the DRC under the Cotonou Agreement to respecting democracy, the rule of law and human rights principles. The resolution condemns all attacks against humanitarian actors and impediments to humanitarian access and urges all parties to the conflict to respect the independence, neutrality and impartiality of humanitarian actors. The resolution equally calls the EU to intensify its dialogue with the DRC and to focus its development cooperation on building better governance and improving the weak military, police and judicial system in the country. The resolution considers that the relevant authorities and the international community must prioritise putting an end to the phenomenon of child soldiers. I voted in favour because I strongly believe that the massacres and crimes against humanity which are still going on in eastern Congo should be stopped promptly.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. It is necessary to condemn the massacres and crimes against humanity that continue to be committed in the eastern region of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and to try to end the criminal activities of all armed groups without exception in the eastern region of the country, as well as to rebuild the authority of the rule of law in the areas of governance and security and to carry out a transparent and thorough investigation into the massacres and crimes carried out as the resolution rightly points out. That is why I think it is necessary to vote in favour of this resolution.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: in writing. I abstained in the final vote of the joint resolution mainly because it does not recognize genocide, calls for the reinforcement of MOUNSCO and in particular through patrols and mobile operations bases. Even though some paragraphs with which I agree call for an assessment, it does not reflect information on the responsibilities of multinationals in financial supporting the conflict and illegal exploitation of natural resources.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. 'We have been talking about the war in Congo for so many years that we have almost forgotten how beautiful it is in times of peace. Entire villages are being executed. Women are brutally slaughtered at the gates of the army posts. Mothers desperately throw their children over the fences of the Monusco camps before they are mowed down. Since 1996, sexual violence has been used as a tactic of war. Every minute a woman is raped in Congo. We can almost speak of a sexual genocide, even though the international community has been present for 16 years. Can the Congolese still rely on us, on Monusco? 10 000 troops pass through and leave no peace but trauma. We need to think about the mandate and the impact. And we all know it: Congo is in demand. As it has already been said here, the natural resources keep the fight burning. President Kabila casts doubt on his ambitions for a third term in office. Only free and fair elections are part of the solution. We have a role to play. Four points: we must continue to support the peace process, take a hard look at the mandate and impact of Monusco, punish impunity and punish the perpetrators, and above all make democracy play a real role. Please give Eastern Congo another future.

name: Jarosław WAŁĘSA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 I voted in favour of the resolution on the massacre in eastern Congo because I believe that concrete measures must be taken to prevent violence from taking place in this area of the world. Thousands of people were forced to leave their homes to save lives. Many people were killed. Violence against women and children has been going on there for years. Despite the protection provided by the UN military, those living there cannot feel safe in any way. This situation leads to an increase in civilian casualties. I believe that the ever-spreading genocide in eastern Congo must be stopped by taking appropriate measures to stop the killers operating there.

name: Theodoros ZAGORAKIS
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 The situation in northeastern Congo is constantly deteriorating. Between October 2014 and May 2016, more than 1,160 people were massacred in parts of North Kivu, while 1,470 disappeared. According to figures incorporated in the resolution, the ongoing conflict has displaced 1.5 million people from their homes, while 400,000 have fled the country. Finally, there is a serious problem in the provision and access to humanitarian aid, as there are increased attacks on members of humanitarian organisations, and there are few cases of kidnappings and humanitarian professionals.  I voted in favour of this initiative, which, among other things, calls on the warring parties to respect the independence, neutrality and impartiality of humanitarian actors.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the resolution on the situation in eastern Congo. The violence faced by its inhabitants is unimaginable and is constantly getting worse. Thousands of people have lost their lives, been kidnapped or forcibly displaced. These massacres are the result of political and ethnic problems in the country, the occupation of parts of the country by armed groups that use the country's mineral wealth to finance them. One of the main sources of tension is also the President, who does not seem to intend to relinquish his mandate and hold proper presidential elections. That is why I think it is right for the European Parliament to use the means it has to do so, and to urge the Congo Government to try to improve the safety of its people and, in particular, to ensure that the crimes per capita are properly investigated so that these crimes do not remain impunity. I therefore hope that the calls of the European Parliament will also help stabilise the situation of this area of congo soon and promote dialogue for the peaceful resolution of conflicts.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. \ u2012 I voted in favour of the joint motion for a resolution on the massacres in eastern Congo. The security and human rights situation in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of Congo continues to deteriorate, with dozens of armed groups still active in the area, and there are numerous reports of massacres, recruitment and use of children in armed groups and widespread sexual and gender-based violence. I therefore support the call for all parties to the conflict to end the violence immediately, to lay down their arms, to release all children from their ranks and to start promoting dialogue for a peaceful and lasting solution to the conflict.

name: Michela GIUFFRIDA
text: Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I voted in favour of this report because I firmly believe that most of the problems that Europe is experiencing today and most of Europe's difficulties can be overcome through education and culture. Religious radicalism, intolerance, violence and populism are all uncomfortable situations that can be defeated by a strong European culture gained in schools, universities, cultural centres and aggregation centres. It's not just schools and teachers who are involved. Today training is also "non-formal". The European Union has created a skills passport to give increasing value to voluntary activities and associations. Especially for those who cannot continue their studies, every positive experience lived from the point of view of commitment and growth is an opportunity for training which, if recognized, leads to the possibility of finding employment. The European Union must effectively support culture, education and training in order to give our children more opportunities to grow up as European citizens and as professionals who can compete on an equal footing.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing. \u2012 Community cooperation in the field of education and training (ET2020) aims to develop a strategic framework to support European citizens in realisation of their training and personal potential. To this end, 4 main objectives have been identified, ranging from structural changes, social cohesion policies to the digitisation of competences. However, the report drawn up does not in any way examine the causes of the serious problems and inefficiencies that characterise the education sector. Austerity policies must not, in any way, harm the education and training of European citizens. For these reasons, I voted against.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The Strategic Framework is a multiannual plan related to the objectives of the Europe 2020 Strategy that aims to increase student mobility, equity, cohesion and active citizenship, as well as an approach to "creativity and innovation, including entrepreneurship". The results of recent years show that the mercantilist orientation of the education system, the standard-setting of educational programmes to increase the competitiveness between pupils and centres, as well as the cuts in austerity programmes implemented in economies such as Spain, have led to an obvious imbalance between the very objectives set by the Commission and the Council, which no longer represent my position in favour of public education , free and quality. This adopted resolution, which assesses a joint report by the Commission and the Council, seeks to legitimize these practices through Parliament, adding minor positive nuances (e.g. by calling for promoting multidisciplinary and adapted training of teachers in the face of new social challenges, or the review of evaluation working groups). That is why, since the report does not address the fundamental problems that lead to an increase in social inequalities, I voted against it.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: In writing. I abstained on this text on monitoring the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training. Indeed, if this report attempts to strike a real balance between the objectives of education and respect for the national competence of the Member States, there is a migration component (school integration of migrants, promoting integration in our societies, facilitating their enrolment in universities) which we cannot support.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. ‒ This report was concerned with European cooperation in education and training. While there were some progressive provisions, particularly those which addressed the need to include refugees and migrants in the education system, the report contained instructions on harmonising national education and training systems, and that runs contrary to the principle of subsidiarity. Sinn Féin is committed to ensuring that the principle of subsidiarity is respected and strengthened at national level. In everyday language, subsidiarity means that decisions should be made at the lowest level possible, i.e. at the level of power that should take action. Erosion or breaches of the principle of subsidiarity can lead to unintended consequences – undermining, for example, citizens’ faith in the European Union – and should, therefore, be avoided. Whilst the report contained some progressive elements, these failed to mitigate the erosion of the principle of subsidiarity, and I therefore voted against it.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on continuity in the implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training (EC 2020), because it refers to extremely important issues such as migration for educational purposes as well as the quality of education/training.

name: Pascal ARIMONT
text: Writing. The Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training, known as ET2020, sets several common educational policy objectives. Following an inventory of the individual Member States and by the Commission, new demands have been drawn up to further strengthen education in Europe.  The adopted report aims to provide more broad support to teachers. As a result of the refugee crisis, classes are as diverse as ever, which also poses a challenge for teachers. Competent education can only benefit integration. In addition, those who build a bridge between theory and practice will be helped by scholarships or loans, as more and more employers complain about the inexperience of young people.  In my opinion, the report tackles the important and new challenges of EU education policy, which is why I voted in favour of it.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This report attempts to strike a balance between the work of this policy framework, which aims at recommendations for reform of national education systems, with respect for national competence and the diversity of countries and needs of Member States. However, the place given to the question of the integration of migrants, ignoring the considerable unemployment in Europe as well as the brain drain in the countries of origin of migrants, prevented me from speaking in favour of this text on which I abstained.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. This report is Parliament's opinion on the implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training (ET2020). At first glance, it seems rather balanced, stressing the importance of taking into account the diversity of Member States' situations, or stressing the importance of the role of the family in education. However, I have not been able to vote in favour of this report, because it must be regretted that these recommendations are marred by an ideological desire to transform ET2020 into a programme to welcome migrants, at the expense of the most fundamental interests and rights of the European people.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I supported this initiative report, which highlights the important problems that exist in terms of accessibility and socio-economic discrimination in education and training. In the current migration context, the report calls for measures to integrate the children of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers into education and training systems. It also stresses the importance of measures to facilitate the enrolment of migrant students, refugees and asylum seekers at university. This is obviously essential to promote their integration and participation in our society.

name: Beatriz BECERRA BASTERRECHEA
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report to highlight the need to increase cooperation in education and training. From a Europeanist view, it presents different measures aimed at increasing the mobility of students and teachers within the EU, one of the great achievements of our Union that needs to be preserved and improved. The report contains a progressive approach in search of integrating the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups in our society. It also aims to combat the different discriminations that still exist today on our continent and that affect LGTBI citizens, the disabled, women or immigrants. The integration of migrants and refugees is another priority. Education is a vital tool to ensure coexistence in our societies as well as to provide opportunities for those citizens who have come to the Union fleeing barbarism, misery and in search of a better future. In an age like today, quality education and training, universal, inclusive and accessible, is one of the greatest assets we have to have a fairer Union and to eradicate the different forms of intolerance.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. \u2012 The great challenges of our time are closely linked to the theme of education and training. Between 2011 and 2014, the average unemployment rate in the European Union of 28 increased by almost 13% among 25- to 29-year-olds who had completed tertiary education. This is alarming and clearly highlights one of the crucial problems of contemporary reality. The Krasnodębski report, on the follow-up to the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training, is an important contribution to analysing the improveable aspects of the Union's commitment to education and training. The crucial issue is to strengthen the recalibration of ET2020, aiming to combine employability with the promotion of social cohesion, equality, non-discrimination and civic competences. Among the different measures to be taken, which go from a proper analysis of the results of the Bologna Process and a correction of the dangerous trends towards policies of cuts in education, is to pay attention to the next European Skills Agenda. This tool will have to address not only economic and employment challenges but also issues related to knowledge of the subject, academic results and above all critical thinking.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: in writing. In 2014, the Commission took stock of the education and training strategy, ET 2020, in cooperation with Member States. On the basis of the conclusions of the resulting report, the Commission set priorities for the period 2016–2020. While these priorities address unquestionable aspects such as inclusive education, equality, equity, non-discrimination, civic competences, well-being, social cohesion, intercultural dialogue, innovation and support for teaching, they remain a wrap with which to prestige a neoliberal conception of education and training. The Krasnodebski report, in line with the Commission, does not hide the conversion of education and training into business, and guides them to employability rather than knowledge development. It is necessary to recognize the inclusion in the report of aspects such as the reception in this area of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers, as well as the gender perspective. However, these necessary inclusions should not pay the toll on the commodization of education; that's why we voted against it.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. U2012 I support the contributions this report makes on the role that education plays in integrating the hundreds of thousands of people who come to our union fleeing violence, war and misery. A work that must reinforce among those of us who are already here the values of union, the best antidote to populism with which this problem is addressed. A task that must also focus on overcoming the gaps that European education offers to those who arrive. A key to insisting on The Humanistic Principle of United in Diversity. I also welcome the strengthening of mechanisms for sharing good practices, the insistence on supporting parents and families as the basic protagonists of the educational process and the involvement in this strategic cooperation of all the actors they can contribute and demonstrating with data that there are policies that give results, even if their protagonists are uncomfortable for some of the Member States. This Parliament has once witnessed and accompanied free criticism, for example, of the Basque education system for its commitment to effective bilingualism which came to be regarded as a sign of support for terrorism. E later this week the BBC set it as an example of integration, innovation and results.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. I preferred to abstain on this report on the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training (ET2020). Indeed, while I welcome the rapporteur's search for balance, in particular by recognising the diversity of Member States in education and training and by recalling that these areas remain their competence, I regret that the report has been misled because of the compromises that the rapporteur has had to make with the other political groups. Thus, good proposals in terms of learning, the quality of the teaching of fundamental knowledge or the recognition of the role of teachers and teachers and the family, are put at risk by the failure to question the Bologna process.  Finally, I regret the proposals concerning the integration of migrants through education, the real humanitarian posture of not depriving countries suffering from emigration of human and economic resources, and working with them to create "educational corridors" allowing students from war zones to continue to study as close as possible to their homes.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 This own-initiative report was initially intended to address priorities in the field of education and training, but was distorted and used to carry out in a partisan manner the issues of the reception of migrants at all costs and the open door policy without distinction between migrants and refugees. For all these reasons, I voted against this text.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. The strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training has been reviewed by the Council and the European Parliament in order to strengthen their effectiveness, reorder priority areas of action and increase their added value. This report, which I have supported, stresses the need to achieve long-term goals while working on specific issues of relevance to each country, such as a low level of participation in adult training, school drop-out, social inclusion or gender gap, among other issues. Thanks to the S&D Group, the need to focus on social inclusion in order to achieve the objectives of ET 2020, improve the inclusion and quality of education and training systems with a perspective of lifelong learning and call for better governance and cooperation in this area has been included. Emphasis is also placed on strengthening digital skills, high-quality early childhood education and inclusive education to ensure equal access and opportunities for all, especially for the most vulnerable groups, while including a specific chapter on migration and education, which calls for the proper integration of migrants , refugees and asylum seekers in education and training systems.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this report because It supports the Commission's review of the ET 2020 programme. In the review evaluation, experts note that one of the consequences of mass interest in higher education is the growing inequalities within education systems. As the system expands, the gap between the best and worst educational institutions in any country increases, which negatively affects the quality of education, the employability of graduates and social cohesion. It is welcomed that aid to educators has been identified as one of the new priority areas for ET 2020, as the quality of teacher training and continuous professional development programmes still does not correspond to the growing range and complexity of competences. But the reports raise concerns that academics are taking a negative view of the Bologna process and employers are complaining about graduate skills and are critical of the new degree structure. The evaluation shows that member states' progress in integrating migrant pupils and students differs. It is also noticeable that it is important to prevent the brain drain or brain-wasting of highly skilled migrants, both for their own and for the benefit of the host countries.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing. – Education and training are important in helping people to acquire the knowledge and professional skills they need to become competitive and innovative employees. They can play an important role in nurturing open-minded, empathic, inquiring human beings and responsible citizens with a strong sense of identity, a deep knowledge of their culture and heritage. We should welcome the fact that the Paris Declaration was reflected in the joint report and that the recalibration of ET2020 has been done by putting on equal footing employability goals and the promotion of social cohesion, equality, non-discrimination and civic competences. ET2020 cooperation, while respecting the competence of Member States, should complement national actions and support Member States in their efforts to develop education and training systems. I welcome the ET2020 stocktaking exercise. The ET2020’s four strategic objectives and current benchmarks remain valid as they were formulated in a comprehensive and forward-looking manner in the ET2020 Council conclusions of 2009, providing a solid basis for ET2020 activities up to 2020. Therefore, I supported this resolution with my vote.

name: Simona BONAFÈ
text: in writing. \u2012 The IF 2020 strategic framework is an important framework for promoting cooperation in education and training, aimed at providing answers and solutions to current common challenges such as qualification needs, the need to support inclusive, lifelong and quality learning, and foster innovation and the development of digital skills.  The resolution voted on today by the European Parliament, which I supported, aims to give greater strength and effectiveness to the strategic framework, reordering its priority areas for action and increasing the added value of the initiatives linked to it.  I also welcomed the fact that, as requested by the Group of Socialists and Democrats, the text adopted in plenary places greater emphasis on the need to promote social inclusion in the training process, ensuring accessibility to education and mobility opportunities at every stage of learning, with particular regard to the most economically and socially disadvantaged groups.

name: Lynn BOYLAN
text: in writing. – This report was concerned with European cooperation in education and training. While there were some progressive provisions, particularly those which addressed the need to include refugees and migrants in the education system, the report contained instructions on harmonising national education and training systems, and that runs contrary to the principle of subsidiarity. Sinn Féin is committed to ensuring that the principle of subsidiarity is respected and strengthened at national level. In everyday language, subsidiarity means that decisions should be made at the lowest level possible, i.e. at the level of power that should take action. Erosion or breaches of the principle of subsidiarity can lead to unintended consequences – undermining, for example, citizens’ faith in the European Union – and should, therefore, be avoided. Whilst the report contained some progressive elements, these failed to mitigate the erosion of the principle of subsidiarity, and I therefore voted against it.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing. \u2012 Young Europeans face common challenges that require common responses. The threat of radicalisation evokes the urgent need to improve educational prospects across all communities. European states must work together to step up joint efforts to reduce school drop-outs, combat social exclusion and support the diversification of pupils in classrooms across Europe. Adapting training provision to the real needs of the labour market and of the citizens working there combined with greater attention to social inclusion are the key to taking young people away from recruiters of organised crime and terrorism, in order to build a more solid and secure future for hundreds of thousands of young Europeans who – to date – are all too often treated as secondary citizens by training institutions.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. "Education and Training 2020" (ET2020) is the framework for cooperation in the field of education and training. This platform for sharing best practices and mutual learning disseminates information and evidence while providing advice and support for reforms. The aim is to reduce the unemployment rate among 18-25 year olds by tackling school drop-out and by facilitating access to universities. This report provides a rather objective finding of the state of the policy framework. Moreover, it recalls that the current trend of assigning the university system to quantitative objectives should not affect the quality of teaching. The rapporteur also points out that ET2020 does not take sufficient account of the specificity of the education problems facing Member States. Although this report is a good move, I abstained on this text which defends free schooling for all illegal migrants. Finally, it is essential to remember that education is an exclusive competence of the Member States.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 Vocational education and training are very important because it helps people acquire the knowledge and professional skills needed to become competitive and innovative employees. It also plays an important role in the formation of open-minded human beings, empathy and curiosity, but also responsible citizens, a strong sense of identity, an in-depth knowledge of their culture and heritage, who respect and know common European values. It is good to know that the recalibration of ET2020 is achieved both by reflecting the Paris Declaration of 17 March 2015 by the Minister of Education, but also by giving great importance to the objectives related to employability, as well as to promoting social cohesion, equality, non-discrimination, but also civic skills. I voted in favour of the report on the measures taken as a result of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of vocational education and training (ET2020), because I believe that the best possible cooperation at European level in education is needed.

name: Cristian-Silviu BUŞOI
text: in writing. \u2012 The main purpose of the 2020 vocational education and training strategy is to support Member States in the development of education and training systems to enable all European citizens to acquire and develop skills and competencies necessary for employment and the continuation of lifelong learning, covering all levels and contexts, i.e. formal, non-formal and informal. I stress that one of the most effective ways of combating inequality and poverty is to strengthen education; I therefore mention that the effectiveness and operational aspects of ET2020 must be strengthened, and I call for greater attention to be paid to the quality of education, starting in kindergarten and then throughout life, which will allow young people to adapt easily to the changing social and economic environment. The Union must respond to the current challenges as soon as possible, so we need urgent measures at national and European level under ET2020 for adult asylum seekers who have recently arrived in Europe. Education is essential for integration, and participation in lifelong learning and training programmes is a chance for newly arrived immigrants.

name: Alain CADEC
text: In writing. Although social policies are the responsibility of Member States, it is important to coordinate them within the single market. "Education and Training 2020" (ET2020) is the European cooperation programme for education and training. This strategic framework makes it easier to achieve European education objectives. Education and training are two key elements in preparing young people for the world of work. This allows as many people as possible to access the skills necessary for integration into the world of work. A collaborative approach also allows for better management of the Erasmus programme. I voted in favour of this report, which proposes a series of measures to improve the ET2020 policy framework.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report today because I believe it is necessary to increase the efficiency of education and training systems and the general levels of skills and competences, better linking the world of work to that of education.  One point in the report that I would like to highlight is support for educators, identified as one of the new priority areas of the 2020 Strategic Framework on Education and Training. The quality of teacher preparation and the programmes for permanent professional development are, unfortunately, still lagging behind the increase in the multiplicity of skills required for teaching.  European cooperation according to the "IF 2020" takes the form of exchanges of information and experience on problems common to the education and training systems of European countries. These exchanges include peer learning, regular monitoring and the regular submission of joint reports and reference tools. It would be appropriate, in view of the acceleration attributable to intra-European mobility and the continuing refugee crisis, to pay particular attention to the needs of the various types of students, belonging to ethnic or religious minorities, from low-income families or immigrants.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ I abstained on this report, which concerns European cooperation in education and training. Although there are some general good elements, addressing the need to include refugees and migrants in the education system, there are some issues with national sovereignty. In particular, the report contains instructions on national education and training systems, with the aim of harmonising those systems, which is contradictory to the principle of subsidiarity. For this reason, I chose to abstain.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this stocktaking report that records the progress of the European education and training framework and puts forward very concrete recommendations to enhance the influence that the framework can exert on society. Europe is under pressure to tackle youth unemployment and the refugee crisis. Strengthened coordination in policymaking and support for education programmes will definitely pay back in the future. I am especially content with the proposal to take account of gender gaps. I believe that the revised framework can provide high-quality education and training so it can effectively assist young people and new immigrants on the job market – which is in the interest of all EU Member States.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 I did not support the report on the evaluation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training. There are, in fact, a number of shortcomings in the own-initiative report, which does not mention the main causes of the worsening problems of the education and training sectors in the EU and does not propose any resolution to the problems of quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination in the field of education.

name: Caterina CHINNICI
text: in writing. \u2012 Education and training are the pillars of personal growth and the development of societies. In the current context, in which the economic crisis has led to high rates of unemployment, in order to support the recovery of economic growth, we must invariably focus on support for education and training, not only in order to adapt job profiles to the new needs of the market. The evaluation of the Education and Training Strategic Framework for 2020 found that early abandonment of education and training courses still remains very high within EU countries, which is why prevention needs to be strengthened.  The quality and effectiveness of training must remain the objectives to be achieved by 2020, but alongside this, urgent measures are also needed at national and European level in the field of education and training for adults seeking asylum who are in Europe. Education remains the key to integration: if national systems are unable to meet this challenge, the risk of social exclusion will be high in the coming years. I voted in favour of this document because I believe that if Europe really wants to achieve its ambition to become the most competitive and dynamic knowledge-based economy, it will have to invest more in these areas.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the report and stress that education and training are important, as they help people secure the knowledge and professional skills they need to make them competitive and innovative workers. In addition, they could play an important role in cultivating open-minded and knowledge-based people with a sensitive and strong sense of identity, as well as a deep knowledge of their culture and heritage, who recognise and honour common European values.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 The report on continuity in the implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training is a special process that we must approach carefully, for the benefit of Europe's pupils and students. Although this report contains positive elements for harmonising procedures for the education and training of citizens at pan-European level, I believe that it fails to avoid discrimination against refugees and migrants in the population as a whole and that is why I have not.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 The education of citizens, especially children, is an issue of fundamental importance to me. Having a cultured, educated community is a truly important strength for Europe. Not only from the point of view of work skills, which is of considerable importance, but also from the point of view of society, since good quality education is an important value in the development of ethical and civil virtues and in strengthening respect for the democratic principles on which Europe is founded. I am convinced that the Eu ropean Union must attach a great deal of importance to this issue and I believe that we need to invest more in this area than is currently being done. For these reasons, which I consider to be of fundamental importance, I have chosen to vote in favour.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report. In a time of high youth unemployment, affecting even graduates, it is of foremost importance to evaluate the European ET2020 framework with a view to increasing its added value and optimising its effectiveness. The stocktaking exercise conducted by the Commission in 2014 concluded with a number of recommendations from the Commission and Council for addressing the problem of the complex landscape of ET2020 and its governance: definition of mandates for the new generation Working Group, involvement of independent experts, closer dialogue, and more regular consultation and coordination between the Commission, Member States and educational stakeholders.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. \u2012 The review of the EF2020 strategic framework was carried out by the Commission in cooperation with the Member States in 2014, and in 2015 the Commission and the Council published a report on the complex overview of the Framework. I support the Krasnodebski Report and, in particular, the new generation of working groups within the Framework with greater representation of the different parties through the inclusion of a greater number of specialists, young workers, representatives of civil society, teachers, etc.  I also support the establishment of an informal coordinating body including several high-level Commission officials, representatives of civil society, the social partners and the EP's Committee on Culture and Education, with the aim of ensuring better coordination, policy coherence and monitoring of the recommendations made by ef2020 bodies. To highlight the need for more attention to be devoted to the quality of education in all cycles and the importance of basic general teaching and learning skills, such as ICT, mathematics, critical thinking, foreign languages, mobility, among others, which allow young people to adapt to a changing social and economic context.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The Strategic Framework is a multiannual plan related to the objectives of the Europe 2020 Strategy that aims to increase student mobility, equity, cohesion and active citizenship, as well as an approach to "creativity and innovation, including entrepreneurship". The results of recent years show that the mercantilist orientation of the education system, the standard-setting of educational programmes to increase the competitiveness between pupils and centres, as well as the cuts in austerity programmes implemented in economies such as Spain, have led to an obvious imbalance between the very objectives set by the Commission and the Council, which no longer represent my position in favour of public education , free and quality. This adopted resolution, which assesses a joint report by the Commission and the Council, seeks to legitimize these practices through Parliament, adding minor positive nuances (e.g. by calling for promoting multidisciplinary and adapted training of teachers in the face of new social challenges, or the review of evaluation working groups). That is why, since the report does not address the fundamental problems that lead to an increase in social inequalities, I voted against it.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing. Education and training are a fundamental human right and a public good accessible to all and certainly contribute to economic development and social cohesion in Europe. The direct consequences of insufficient investment in this area are poverty, social exclusion, inequalities at all levels. I therefore support this resolution, which recognises the need for a more coordinated and effective strategy to solve the long-held problems of quality, access and socio-economic discrimination in education and training. The Eu ropean Cooperation Instrument in the Field of Education and Training (IF2020) already provides important guidelines for guiding the efforts and capacities of the EU and its Member States.  However, given the different socio-economic situation and educational traditions of the Member States, uniform prescriptive approaches at European level must be avoided and each State should instead encourage students to achieve and exploit their academic achievements and specific skills in the labour market.  The resolution takes into account both levels: national specificities and the need for a coordinated approach at European level to strengthen social convergence, promote active citizenship through formal and informal education and prevent radicalisation. This approach must also include refugees, migrants and asylum seekers.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: in writing. \u2012 Through European cooperation in the field of vocational education and training, Member States have the opportunity to promote a range of educational policies that promote the equitable distribution of knowledge among the population, decreasing socio-economic disparities and increasing the level of social inclusion. I believe that access to quality education and training programmes is a right that must be guaranteed to all European citizens. Without losing sight of the importance of acquiring practical skills for professional integration, it is elementary that vocational education and training systems enable the achievement of cross-cutting civic, social and intercultural skills that are beneficial to the development of creativity and critical thinking. Furthermore, by promoting democratic values and principles and increasing investment in education, research and innovation, a truly inclusive system can be created, significantly reducing the chances of emerging extremist and radical currents. I voted in favour of this report, wishing to reiterate the importance of non-discriminatory access to education and training, the transmission of social, civic and ethical principles and values, the support of teaching staff and increased investment in this area. I would therefore like to encourage cooperation and the exchange of best practices, inspired by different European traditions, with the aim of undertaking ambitious, coordinated and effective policy actions at European level.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The European Commission has announced a specific set of priorities for European cooperation in the field of education and training. Education and training is important because it helps people acquire the professional knowledge and qualifications they need to become competitive and innovative workers. Moreover, education and training can play an important role in educating people with broad horizons, sensitive and inquisitive, as well as responsible citizens with a strong sense of identity, a thorough knowledge of their culture and heritage. The aim of the report is to step up cooperation between working groups and directorates-general or high-level groups, to define mandates for the next generation of working groups, to define the structure of their work and the results to be achieved. It is important to involve more independent experts in the field of education. Close dialogue between the Commission, Member States and education stakeholders is necessary to ensure real action. Much attention has been paid to the needs of different categories of learners, such as people from ethnic or religious minorities, poor children or children with migrant backgrounds. The report calls for qualitative changes in mobility policy, solutions to the problems that arise in accelerated intra-European mobility and which arise for national education and training systems from the current refugee crisis. I agree with the provisions of this report. I therefore voted in favour of it.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ Education and training are an important basis for integration and employability. Urgent measures are also required at national and European levels, within the ET2020 framework, in the field of education and training for adult asylum seekers who have recently arrived in Europe. It is important that Member States have a strategic framework in order to address the issues of diversity and segregation. We must ensure that highly skilled migrants are employed in the interest of the host country and the migrants themselves. For these reasons I voted in favour of the report.

name: Viorica DĂNCILĂ
text: in writing. \u2012 I believe that communication strategies between school and parents and character formation and other personal development programmes implemented in the learning environment, in cooperation with families and other relevant social partners, can contribute to upward social convergence, to the promotion of active citizenship and European values. I also believe that an encouraging family environment is essential for children to acquire their basic skills properly and highlights the value of courses for parents, which can prove effective in combating educational poverty.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which has no binding legislative value, which calls for optimising the effectiveness of the European framework for education and training in the European Union. In the face of an ever-increasing youth unemployment rate in many Member States, it is essential to improve proven tools, such as apprenticeships. In the face of the migration crisis, some paragraphs in the report mention better integration of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers into European education and training systems. I regret the vagueness surrounding these different mentions, but because I support the integration of political refugees, I still voted for the paragraphs in question. Because education allows for integration and increased involvement in our society, especially financial, it must be offered to people who obtain the right to settle in our countries.

name: Jean-Paul DENANOT
text: In writing. The text of this report provides a very comprehensive inventory of the measures to be promoted and put in place to ensure the efficiency and justice of European school and training systems in a knowledge society. From innovation to decommissioning, from formal to informal, from small classes to the care of refugees, from disrespect to radicalisation, from employability to the formation of a critical mind, it sheds light on all the issues, risks and difficulties in achieving education and emancipating in a world of profound change and where the benchmarks in terms of knowledge and competence are challenged by the digital. He also recalls the evils of austerity policies that have seen some states reduce their budgetary efforts in school and higher education. It is in the interest of this report to show how extremely effective the European Commission is on diagnosis and completely contradictory in its injunctions!

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. This report has the merit of balancing the work of the policy framework, which aims to make recommendations for reform of national education systems, and respect for the national competence and diversity of the cultures and needs of Member States. Unfortunately, it contains a politically correct component relating to migrants, including calling for their university enrolment to be made easier. Given that it was part of the joint report of the Commission and the Council, it was difficult to exclude it. For this reason, I preferred to abstain.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: in writing. \u2012 Following the announcement of a set of priorities of the European Commission in the field of education and training, my colleague Krasnodebski produced a report, which I strongly support. It underlines that there is a problem with the outflow of skilled labour from most Member States, including Bulgaria, recommendations for closer cooperation, with a view to better quality and effectiveness of education and training at all levels. However, I abstained in the final vote because, in order to reach consensus with the other groups, Prof . Krasnodebsky has agreed in several places to include unacceptable proposals for me and my policy aimed at immigrants – such as the recommendation of special "education corridors" for newly arrived refugees to allow them to enroll in European universities, which for me personally suggests that the next step will be to create quotas for those who will give them privileges at the expense of EU citizens which I don't think is right.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. \u2012 We vote against. This unacceptable text proves once again that the Union, instead of being interested in how to stop the continuing deterioration of education in Europe, is only concerned with illegal immigrants and socially misfit ideologues who try to impose their views on pupils.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The joint report published by the Commission and the Council addresses the problem of the complex overview of the ET 2020 strategic framework, which has not always been clearly understood by some participants or by a part of the community at large. Some Member States should continue to improve the way they interact with formal and formal structures by making sure that the right people are sent to the right meetings and that the use of substitutes is reduced to a minimum. Urgent action at national and European level is therefore needed under the ET 2020 strategic framework in the education and training sector of adult asylum seekers newly arrived in Europe. Given that education is essential for integration and employability, the lack of response to this challenge by national systems could lead to a worsening of social disparities and cultural segregation and thus intensify the existing trend towards the formation of parallel societies.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 Cooperation and exchange of good practice between Member States in the areas of education and training can be positive. However, it is important to examine the content, background of EF 2020 and its priorities. The strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training (ET 2020) is part of the EU's neoliberal approach. Both initial and new priorities try to harmonise Member States' education and training systems with EU economic and employment policies.  The report contains positive aspects, critical of the current situation of education and training. But it cannot differentiate itself from the EU's dominant approach. Mobility, employability and entrepreneurship are examples. Under ET 2020, education and training are put at the service of market demands. Reductive and wrong view, of which we disagree. Although we agree with some points of the report, taken into view in isolation, they end up being contradictory to the general view that underlies it. The objectives of reducing the rate of early school leaving and increasing young people with a higher education degree should not be met to the detriment of quality in education - the report states. That's all right. But what are the "relevant qualifications and competencies"? Relevant to whom? The devil (too) is in the details.

name: Santiago FISAS AYXELÀ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because I believe it is a major step forward in achieving the proposed goals for better training and education at European level, through the comparison of best practices and by encouraging a better transition to the labour market, the use of new pedagogical forms, as well as progress in transparency and recognition of qualifications.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. Education and training are essential tools for the formation of responsible citizens, with a strong sense of identity, a deep knowledge of their culture and heritage and who recognise and honour shared European values. However, in the last decade, despite an increase in the number of people having access to formal education, Europe still has unprecedented levels of youth unemployment, which also affects graduates.  I voted in favour of the IF 2020 strategy, because it promotes a qualitative leap in European cooperation on the quality of education. Each national education system must be able to support the implementation of opportunities for our young people, through exchanges of information and experience on the problems common to the education and training systems of European countries. In addition, lifelong learning and mobility must become a reality for our countries, with vocational education and training systems more responsive to change and to the rest of the world.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 The past decade has meant a significant increase in the number of university-educated people throughout the European Union. At the same time, the number of unemployed increased the most precisely for young university students. Unfortunately, the masses of higher education have, in many cases, come at the expense of its quality. The responses of employers are a clear measure. They talk about the insufficient level of knowledge and skills of university graduates. They draw attention to significant differences between their needs and training at higher education institutions. The mismatch between education and the requirements of practice has a negative impact on the applicability and ability of young people to compete on the labour market. We must also avoid artificially enforcing higher education. There are a large number of professions where the condition for obtaining a diploma is indeed extra. It costs us a lot of money from public funds. The Erasmus exchange programme is a success in European cooperation between higher education institutions. However, the motivation of students to go on a foreign exchange sometimes appears problematic. This is also evidenced by the disproportionately high popularity of some southern countries.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report because it does not deal with the subject adequately and partially; it is too politicised and exploited.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on continuity in the implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training, as this unacceptable text proves once again that the Union, instead of being interested in how to stop the continuing deterioration of education in Europe, is only concerned with illegal immigrants and socially ill-adjusted ideologues trying to impose their views on pupils.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The ET2020 education and training strategic framework has been revisited by the Council and Parliament in order to strengthen its effectiveness, reorder the priority areas of action and increase its added value. The ET2020 stocktaking exercise underlines the need to achieve the long-term goals while working on issues of country-specific relevance: low rates of adult learning, early school leaving, social inclusion, the gender gap, teacher training, etc. As the S&D Group, we have included the need for maximum focus on social inclusion in order to reach the ET2020 targets and improve the inclusiveness and the quality of education and training systems in a lifelong learning perspective, and we are calling for better governance and cooperation in this area. Digital skills, high-quality early childhood education and inclusive education, to ensure equal access and opportunities for all, including access to mobility opportunities especially for VET and more vulnerable groups are all important. A specific chapter is included on migration and education, calling for the proper integration of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers in education and training systems. I voted in favour of the report.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted positively in favour of this report, as the aim is to increase the added value of the framework in force and to optimise its effectiveness. Education and training play an important role in acquiring the knowledge and professional skills that enable employees to become competitive and innovative. Over the past decade, the number of people in tertiary education has increased sharply, but at the same time there has been unprecedented high unemployment among young people. Between 2011 and 2014, the average unemployment rate in the EU-28 increased particularly among young people (25-29 years old) with tertiary education (+12.9%). This process must be terminated. the Education and Training 2020 strategy can be an important tool for cultivating a knowledge-based economy and promoting social inclusion.  The targets set an appropriate minimum threshold for qualifications and concern an increase in the level of education. An important aspect of a responsible education policy is the development of links between schools and families. A supportive background environment at home can not only help to counteract educational poverty, but can also hinder the attractiveness of violent extremism among young people. In addition, it is important to involve parents in the current debates on education. Parents' organisations should be involved in the work of Education and Training 2020 and apply best practices on school-family cooperation.

name: Enrico GASBARRA
text: in writing. \u2012 It is not possible to build a path of economic and employment growth without promoting a strategic framework for cooperation between Member States on education and training. I firmly believe that the main responsibility that we parliamentarians assume during our term of office is to choose the priorities to be supported, so that the objectives we set ourselves here in Europe can enter our homes, changing the lives of citizens and our children. I believe that investing in education that is innovative and open to digital content and tools, fair and accessible, inclusive, more demand-oriented in the world of work, non-discriminatory and based on lifelong learning, is not only necessary but urgent.  Learning to reread mobility as an opportunity and not as a complication will make it easier for the new generations to integrate, feel like citizens of the world and thus multiply their possibilities by broadening their prospects for active citizenship. That is why I voted in favour of mr Zdzisław Krasnodębski's report.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the resolution on the follow-up to the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (IF 2020), because I believe that education is primarily a public good and that references to 'education and training', should include formal and informal forms and should not only aim to respond to the needs of the labour market, but should be an intrinsic value , as they contribute to personal development and citizen growth. As stated in the Annual Growth Survey for 2014, Member States need to find ways to protect or promote longer-term investment in education, research and innovation, so it is essential to invest in modernising education and training systems, including lifelong learning. However, many Member States, whose public budgets are under great pressure from budgetary rules, have made substantial cuts in spending on education and training.  Nevertheless, there is no doubt that the funds available and future investment in training and education must be made more efficient as a factor affecting production, competitiveness and growth, as stated in the recent special report of the European Court of Auditors.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: Writing. I voted in favour of the "Report on the follow-up to the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (ET2020)". Education and training are an important building block – across borders – to give young people the chance to see Europe's fundamental values and added value constructively and critically. I am keen to promote this.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. The resolution deals, inter alia, with the management and coordination of ET2020 at all levels, the enforcement of high-quality education and training, and migration and education. This is particularly important in times of high youth unemployment and makes an evaluation of the European framework ET2020 all the more necessary. One of our main priorities is the education of young people. Above all, an improvement of the circumstances for teachers is necessary. However, the Commission is also expected to play some leadership role. It will carry out research on radicalisation, violence and bullying in all Member States.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. In 2014, the Commission took stock of the education and training strategy, ET 2020, in cooperation with Member States.
