On the basis of the conclusions of the resulting report, the Commission set priorities for the period 2016–2020. While these priorities address unquestionable aspects such as inclusive education, equality, equity, non-discrimination, civic competences, well-being, social cohesion, intercultural dialogue, innovation and support for teaching, they remain a wrap with which to prestige a neoliberal conception of education and training. The Krasnodebski report, in line with the Commission, does not hide the conversion of education and training into business, and guides them to employability rather than knowledge development. It is necessary to recognize the inclusion in the report of aspects such as the reception in this area of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers, as well as the gender perspective. However, these necessary inclusions should not pay the toll on the commodization of education; that's why we voted against it.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. Education and training 2020 (ET2020) is the framework for cooperation in education and training. It covers exchanges of best practice, mutual learning, gathering and dissemination of information and evidence of what works, as well as the provision of advice and support for policy reforms between Member States. The report presented follow-up on Erasmus + at all levels, and on training and education for people of all ages.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: Writing. \u2012 The rapporteur's general approach is based on the logic that education should be defined in the context of market needs. However, the report includes a number of important amendments, with which we agree (the need to integrate refugees into the education system, criticism of the flight of young scientists abroad, recognition of high rates of youth unemployment, criticism of the cut-off of funds for education in many Member States and many others), in particular with regard to the wider role that the positive amendments included in the report can potentially contribute (and contribute to a certain extent) to cohesion policy and to the greatest possible extent. reduction of local socio-economic disparities.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report on Education and Training 2020 (ET2020) which aims to improve control and coordination of the existing framework (e.g. by extending working groups with various stakeholders, such as civil society representatives, teachers and youth workers), in order to enhance the quality of education and training, and to highlight the migration aspect. I was happy that the report stressed the need to prioritise the integration of migrants and asylum seekers into the labour market, e.g. by quickly setting up a system of language courses and basic skills training. It is important that past mistakes on immigration are not replicated in the future, for that could lead to integration difficulties in Member States. Thankfully, this report points out the major role of education, training and sport in this process. Better cooperation between the EU and the national authorities is required in order to find the right approach to the full integration of migrants and asylum seekers into education and training systems and to ensure that existing qualifications are properly recognised.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution, as I did not have any objections to the final report.

name: Hans-Olaf HENKEL
text: Writing. The own-initiative report analyses the strategic framework of "Education and Training 2020".  Each EU country is responsible for its own education and training systems, as this is not a core competence of the EU. The role of EU policies is to support national actions and help address common challenges. This report is basically about evaluating the Education and Training 2020 framework and making recommendations at the level of cooperation, quality and efficiency. Countries receive advice and support for political reforms. The ALFA agrees with the core content of this report and supports a large number of the improvements mentioned in the report. All that should be mentioned here are better communication, better quality of education, support and further development of teachers, recognition of qualifications and integration of migrants entitled to reside in our education systems. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report. However, if the European Commission were to launch a draft law on this matter in the future, I will weigh much more critically whether this is not an attempt to impose common rules on the Member States.

name: Filiz HYUSMENOVA
text: in writing. \u2012 Dear Mr President, I support the report on the follow-up of the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training, as I am convinced that more and more targeted support is needed to Member States' efforts to develop their training and education systems, taking into account the differences between them and their specific needs. Unfortunately, the so-called " "educational poverty" and the low inclusion of people with low socio-economic status in the education system remains a challenge facing Europe. At the same time, high-quality and comprehensive education and training, meeting the needs of the labour market and developing '21st century skills', are key to the EU's social, cultural and economic development. I therefore believe that the conclusions of the review of the ET 2020 strategic framework need to be taken into account and the lessons learned from them implemented immediately in order to optimise the framework and take more ambitious, coordinated and effective policy action in the field of education and training at European and national level.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report which provides for the correct and efficient use of the framework on measures taken as a result of the strategic climate for European cooperation in the field of vocational education and training (ET2020). Education contributes enormously to the training of the European adult, free, creative and knowledgeable. At the heart of the professional skills acquired is vocational education and training. It must be encouraged both by effective programmes such as Erasmus+ and by contributing to the added value of human potential, of future responsible European citizens with a strong sense of identity, with a complete knowledge of their culture and heritage.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the Follow-Up Report on the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (ET 2020), as I consider inclusive and high-quality education and training to be essential for Europe's cultural, economic and social development. This Report welcomes the ET 2020 Scoreboard and stresses the need to take account of its conclusions and implement them without delay in order to increase added value and optimise the effectiveness of the framework, which will strengthen the importance for each country and mutual learning. Education should contribute to the personal development, mutual respect and growth of young people in order to make them proactive, responsible and aware citizens with civic, social and intercultural cross-sectoral competences and qualified professionals.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. This report aims to instigate reforms of national education systems and to maintain respect for national competence and cultural diversity. The "politically correct" report on migrants is regrettable. It thus follows their recommendations and advocates the school integration of migrants, but it assumes it with a view to promoting their integration into our societies. In particular, he called for their university enrolment to be made easier. However, he makes up for it by pointing to the risk of "brain drain" arising from mobility programmes. This report, while generally satisfactory, has some flaws and that is why I abstained.

name: Petr JEŽEK
text: Writing. \u2012 Given the high youth unemployment, as well as the new challenge of migration, European cooperation in education and training needs to be reassessed. ET 2020 is a forum for the exchange of best practices, mutual learning, collection and dissemination of information, where working groups composed of experts appointed by Member States cooperate. The report aims to improve the control and coordination of the existing framework in order to further improve the quality of education and training. It also wants to pay more attention precisely to the integration of asylum seekers into the labour market, e.g. through language courses and basic skills training, and to help improve their qualifications and, consequently, their chances of employment in the labour market. I was happy to support the report taking into account new trends and challenges.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on the monitoring of the European strategic framework ET2020 (education and training). The aim of the text is to increase the added value and optimise the effectiveness of this strategic framework, even though the youth unemployment rate, at the highest in the Union, and which also affects young graduates, calls for a strong response from the European institutions.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. The strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training is intended to promote the cultural, economic and social development of Europe. Education plays an important role in combating poverty and social exclusion, but focusing on migrants, as much as the rapporteur puts it, hardly serves the objective of economic development for European citizens. I therefore do not agree with this report.

name: Bernd KÖLMEL
text: Writing. The own-initiative report analyses the strategic framework of "Education and Training 2020".  Each EU country is responsible for its own education and training systems, as this is not a core competence of the EU. The role of EU policies is to support national actions and help address common challenges. This report is basically about evaluating the Education and Training 2020 framework and making recommendations at the level of cooperation, quality and efficiency. Countries receive advice and support for political reforms. The ALFA agrees with the core content of this report and supports a large number of the improvements mentioned in the report. All that should be mentioned here are better communication, better quality of education, support and further development of teachers, recognition of qualifications and integration of migrants entitled to reside in our education systems. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report. However, if the European Commission were to launch a draft law on this matter in the future, I will weigh much more critically whether this is not an attempt to impose common rules on the Member States.

name: Kateřina KONEČNÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 Although I agreed with these when adopting the various articles of the resolution, I abstained when adopting the overall text of the resolution. The motion for a resolution summarises the objectives of European cooperation in the field of Union education and training. The resolution highlights, inter alia, the integration of immigrant children into society precisely through their full-fledged education, the functionality of the so-called Bologna system, the need for better financial evaluation and lifelong learning for teachers at all levels, and the benefits and challenges of the Erasmus programme. It also mentions the ongoing problems of unequal access to quality education in the EU and the unemployment of graduates of certain universities. First of all, in my opinion, the resolution focuses in detail on some of the less important issues and, on the contrary, only marginally affects the essential ones. I would therefore appreciate less emphasis on the cooperation of private companies with educational institutions or the adaptation of the Bologna system, and, on the contrary, a greater emphasis on equal access to quality education without social discrimination, as well as fair financial evaluation of teachers. In line with the above, I therefore abstained when approving the resolution.

name: Agnieszka KOZŁOWSKA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The report on the European Framework for Cooperation in Education and Training (ET 2020) by Zdzisław Krasnodębski deserves support as it addresses key EU educational policy activities, bringing together labour market and education sectors. draws attention to the EU's main challenges in this regard: the problem of educational impoverishment in migrant and low socio-economic environments, the inadequate links between higher education and vocational education and training and research institutions and the economic sector, as well as the huge demand for digital skills needed to move around in a digitised world;  I regret that the latter aspect - the need for new skills - occupies such a modest position in the report, since, in the perception of experts and the European Commission, new skills are a topic worthy of a separate agenda, which is considered a breakthrough in the context of the future of the European Union. The report rightly recommends greater involvement of universities in the ET 2020 work cycle; stresses the importance of mobility within the EU and high-quality early childhood education, which has a significant impact on the further stages of vocational education and training. Calls for non-discrimination and facilitation for migrants, refugees and asylum seekers are also positive in the report. At the same time, the report calls for the issue of unequal migration rates within the EU to be addressed, leading to a brain drain in eastern and southern European countries.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. Although the number of people getting tertiary education has increased, the proportion of young unemployed has unfortunately also increased. The EU has therefore put in place the IF2020 framework, to promote the education and training of young people, which are necessary to acquire professional skills and become competitive workers. The Commission has presented an assessment of this framework, accepting a number of recommendations aimed at maximising its effectiveness.  The aim is therefore to define the role of informal governance bodies, to include independent experts, to promote dialogue and to improve communication and cooperation between the Commission, the Member States and educational organisations. At such a sensitive time for our young people, it is necessary to analyse in the best possible way the policies necessary to contribute to the creation of a more prosperous future.  For these reasons, I welcome the exercise of assessing the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I abstained on this report because, while it is theoretically trying to respect the diversity of the cultures and education policies of the Member States, it serves as a Trojan horse for the European model of immigration.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I abstained on the report on monitoring the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training. This text is rather balanced. In particular, it reminds us that education and training should not only focus on the needs of the labour market, i.e. they should not be used to alienate learners by reducing them to economic data. It also reminds us that Member States do not always face the same challenges in this area and that it is a question of taking into account their diversity of circumstances. It stresses the importance of the role of the family in education. He was also concerned about the current trend of assigning performance targets to universities at the expense of the quality of teaching, which could, in particular, jeopardize the teaching of the humanities. Unfortunately, the report has a "politically correct" and naïve component on immigration.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. The ET2020 must meet several objectives set out in the Education and Training 2020 programme. These criteria set a number of imperatives, such as reaching by 2020 a proportion of less than 15% of 15-year-olds with insufficient proficiency in basics (reading, mathematics, science), or having 95% of children from four years of age in preschool education. The rapporteur studies these points and makes common sense remarks. It stresses that quantitative objectives must not override qualitative objectives and also stresses the primary place of the family in education. Finally, it calls on the Commission to be honest about the potential negative consequences of student mobility. Despite some ideologically correct statements on migration, this report is balanced. So I'm in favour of it and vote FOR.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because it points to the need to achieve long-term objectives in the field of education and training while working on specific issues of relevance to each country such as a low level in adult learning, school dropout, social inclusion, gender gap, teacher training Etc. It focuses on social inclusion in order to achieve the ET 2020 objectives, to improve the inclusion and quality of education and training systems with a perspective of lifelong learning and calling for better governance and cooperation in this area. Strengthening digital skills, high-quality early childhood education and inclusive education to ensure equal access and opportunities for all, especially the most vulnerable groups. A specific chapter on migration and education has also been included, calling for the proper integration of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers into education and training systems.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The Strategic Framework is a multiannual plan related to the objectives of the Europe 2020 Strategy that aims to increase student mobility, equity, cohesion and active citizenship, as well as an approach to "creativity and innovation, including entrepreneurship". The results of recent years show that the mercantilist orientation of the education system, the standard-setting of educational programmes to increase the competitiveness between pupils and centres, as well as the cuts in austerity programmes implemented in economies such as Spain, have led to an obvious imbalance between the very objectives set by the Commission and the Council, which no longer represent my position in favour of public education , free and quality. This adopted resolution, which assesses a joint report by the Commission and the Council, seeks to legitimize these practices through Parliament, adding minor positive nuances (e.g. by calling for promoting multidisciplinary and adapted training of teachers in the face of new social challenges, or the review of evaluation working groups). That is why, since the report does not address the fundamental problems that lead to an increase in social inequalities, I voted against it.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. U2012 Education and training are important to help people acquire the knowledge and professional skills that enable them to become competitive and innovative employees.  Urgent action is needed at national and European level, also within the framework of ET 2020, in the field of education and training. Education is essential for integration and employability, and the failure of national systems to meet this challenge can increase social divisions and cultural segregation. It is also important to prevent the waste of the talent of highly skilled migrants, as well as to strengthen the link between schools and families as it is the parents who are responsible for the education of their children.  I believe that a good measure would be the preparation by the Commission of a decision to ensure horizontal coverage of the issue of migration in the mandates of all working groups and to develop reciprocal learning activities in order to determine what good practices are for the effective integration of migrants. In this regard, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Bernd LUCKE
text: Writing. The own-initiative report analyses the strategic framework of "Education and Training 2020".  Each EU country is responsible for its own education and training systems, as this is not a core competence of the EU. The role of EU policies is to support national actions and help address common challenges. This report is basically about evaluating the Education and Training 2020 framework and making recommendations at the level of cooperation, quality and efficiency. Countries receive advice and support for political reforms. The ALFA agrees with the core content of this report and supports a large number of the improvements mentioned in the report. All that should be mentioned here are better communication, better quality of education, support and further development of teachers, recognition of qualifications and integration of migrants entitled to reside in our education systems.  For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report, without prejudice to my unchanged view that the EU has no legislative competence in education matters.

name: Mairead McGUINNESS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which outlines key priorities in helping to combat the high level of youth unemployment and promote inclusivity in education and our society.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted against. I reject the call that education ministers must work with the European Commission 'to ensure equal access to high-quality education, in particular to try to draw the most disadvantaged and those from different backgrounds, including newly arrived migrants, into this process and integrate them into a positive learning environment'. Education is a matter for nation states and the EU is not supposed to talk into it.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 As you know, the primary objectives of the Strategic System "Education and Training 2020", which were set 7 years ago, are to make lifelong learning and mobility a reality, to improve the quality and effectiveness of education and training, to promote justice, social cohesion and civic activity, and to promote innovation and creativity, including entrepreneurial spirit, at all levels of education and training. The system also includes proponing up pre-primary education assets and improving the general level of literacy. Although significant progress was made in the education itself, it was among young university graduates that unemployment grew at the fastest rate in recent years. I therefore agree unequivocally that education systems should pay maximum attention to preparing young people for the conditions of the real labour market so that they can integrate more actively into it. The same applies to the improvement of the imitating of the teaching profession and the relevant working conditions, as in part of the Member States this profession is one of the lowest paid, and a significant proportion of employees are even older than retirement age. It is understandable that these issues fall primarily within the competence of the Member States, but ET 2020 and other associated programmes could also bring about positive changes.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: Writing. \u2012 The quality of education and training of the current generation of children and young people directly depends on the quality of life of future generations. Education for young people, but also for adults, is a necessity at a time of globalisation that can help people to take up the labour market and improve their lives. I consider it essential that training and education can respond flexibly to the needs of practice and that material, technical and financial security can sufficiently meet the needs of modern education. The European Union has established the ET 2020 strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training and has developed financial instruments to promote quality education. It is now up to the Member States how efficiently and rationally they can use these resources and thus contribute to increasing their competitiveness.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the follow-up to the implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training ('EC 2020'), for the reasons I mentioned in detail in my speech to the plenary of the European Parliament in Brussels on 22/6/2016 and because this report is not complete and substantiated.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I abstained on this text. The strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training aims to exchange best practices for reforms. For education for 2020, targets include reducing the proportion of 15-year-olds with poor literacy skills to 15%, or reaching 82% of employment rates for graduates aged 20 to 34.  The draft text focuses on the joint report of the Commission and the Council on the implementation of the strategic framework. The report is balanced and has many positive points. It specifies, for example, that learners should not be reduced to an economic data, the importance of the role of the family in education or that member states should be taken into account. It reiterates the importance of not aiming at quantitative at the expense of quality, particularly with regard to the target of 40% of young people obtaining a degree.  On the other hand, the report advocates the school integration of migrants, in particular through their university enrolment. It calls on Member States to consider "diversity" as a wealth for the education system as a whole, etc.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training. The Overall Evaluation Exercise of the IF 2020 Framework, conducted by the Commission in cooperation with member states, addresses the complex landscape of if 2020.  The aim of the report is to strengthen the role of informal governance bodies and to involve independent experts in training, in the work of working groups and other IF 2020 bodies, so that common policy instruments at European level and urgent measures at national and European level in the field of education and training are defined.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. My vote in favour of a report discussed in this House on the follow-up to the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training (ET 2020). So far this strategy seems to be delivering results, but we must work hard to strengthen education and training policies and ensure the quality of education provided, as education is a key element for integration and employability.

name: Costas MAVRIDES
text: Writing. \u2012 Education and training are important tools for finding a job, since today employers have more requirements than the knowledge and professional skills of the people they hire. The Union's objective is therefore to promote education and training for the cultivation of innovative and open-minded workers that will contribute to Europe's prosperity and development. Broader issues to address are certainly the reduction of unemployment and the fight against discrimination. I would like to vote in favour of reducing high unemployment rates, especially with regard to young people who, even though they are university graduates, are not absorbed by the professional fields. This is also one of the most important work to be done by the Union through the Europe 2020 strategy, which sets a minimum level of education and the expansion of higher education levels. This, of course, presupposes that there will also be an improvement in quality at all levels of education. Quality improvement can be achieved through the exploitation of qualified academics, but also by promoting the intra-European mobility of young students through programmes such as Erasmus, thus helping young scientists to gain experience in education systems in other Member States.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. The report rightly recognises that humanistic training offers better opportunities in professional life. It also addresses the increase in radicalisation in primary schools. However, this report seeks to give asylum seekers easier access to our training system. It will also make it easier to recognise non-European degrees. This must be clearly rejected.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. Work on this framework is aimed at making recommendations for reforming national education systems. I note that the report attempts to strike a balance between the work of this policy framework and respect for the competence of states, the diversity of their cultures and needs. However, these good recommendations are being hijacked by a European model of migrant integration that slips into the background. As a result I voted abstention.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. Education and training must not only be intended to adapt to the needs of the labour market, but must also be an intrinsic value in themselves, since education plays as important a role in the development of ethics and civilism as in respecting Europe's founding democratic principles. Education should contribute to the personal development, mutual respect and growth of young people in order to make them willing, responsible and conscious citizens, endowed with civic, social and transversal cultural skills, in addition to qualified professionals. Inclusive and high-quality training and education are essential for cultural, economic and social development.  Hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I am in favour of this report, as it addresses the need for both national and EU-level policy concerning lack of access to education, poor quality of education, and socio-economic discrimination in education. The report provides concrete recommendations for improving the quality of education and the training of future educators across the EU.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: Written. – As a former teacher, the education and education of young people is particularly close to my heart. Quality education ensures that young people become skilled professionals, that they acquire the necessary competences and skills. But education is also a value in itself. It contributes to the development of civic and moral values. Responsible teachers are key figures in the development of young people into conscious and committed European citizens. Youth unemployment in Europe is still far too high. That is why I support the recommendations in this report calling for effective investment in education and training.  For example, establishing partnerships in the Member States between education and the labour market can be a source of sustainable growth. Acquiring the necessary competences, promoting student mobility and inclusive education are priorities in the fight against youth unemployment. The call for Member States to also pay increased attention to the development of social skills, the promotion of active citizenship and European values in the learning objectives deserves all the support. The teaching of social and human competences is an essential and effective pedagogical tool to prevent emerging forms of radicalisation in young people.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: Writing. – A close dialogue needs to be established between the European Commission, the Member States of the Union and education stakeholders, which should be conducted through regular consultations and coordination meetings in order to actually take follow-up to the recommendations made by civil society groups in the field of education. I consider it essential that independent experts in the field of education are more involved in the work of working groups and other bodies for the ET 2020 Strategic Framework. The problems facing Europe cannot be meaningfully solved without strengthening the links between schools and families and without recognising that parents are primarily responsible for their children's education. A supportive domestic environment can help not only to combat educational under-education, but also to counter balance the lure of violent extremism among young people. It is important for parents as educators to set an example for children, to develop their moral and civic values, to create an atmosphere of openness at home, to nurture responsibility for children and to allow them to participate meaningfully in decisions that relate to their lives. I consider it of the utmost importance that parents' associations should also be involved in the work on the ET 2020 strategic framework. I agree with the proposal in question.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the follow-up report on the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (ET2020) which puts its strongest focus on social inclusion in reaching the ET2020 targets – improving the inclusiveness and the quality of education and training systems in a lifelong learning perspective – and calls for better governance and cooperation in this area. I have always supported the development of digital skills, high-quality early childhood education and inclusive education as means of ensuring equal access and opportunities for all. Therefore, I voted in favour of the non-legislative resolution that promotes those objectives.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 A summary evaluation of the Education and Training 2020 framework was carried out by the Commission in 2014. The Committee on Culture and Education's motion for a resolution on this point out that education and training play an important role in acquiring the knowledge and professional skills needed to make employees competitive and innovative. In addition, they can play an important role in educating broad-minded, empathetic, interested people and responsible citizens who have a strong sense of identity, a good knowledge of their culture and traditions, and recognise and respect common European values.  The report notes with satisfaction that, in adapting the framework, equal emphasis has been placed on employability objectives, as well as on social cohesion, equality, non-discrimination and civic competences. The report highlights that, although the number of people in tertiary education has increased sharply over the past decade, at the same time there is unprecedented high unemployment among young people in Europe, including those with tertiary education. It specifically addresss the role of education and training in the integration of the masses arriving in Europe during migration. I voted in favour of this report.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. Overall, this is a good report, which attempts to strike a balance between the work of this policy framework, which aims to make recommendations for reforms of national education systems, and respect for national competence and the diversity of the cultures and needs of Member States. The "politically correct" component on migrants may be regretted, but given that it was part of the joint report of the Commission and the Council, it was difficult to exclude it. We must also remain very careful about the purely quantitative objectives of education for all as presented by the ET2020 programme.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The Education and Training 2020 strategy establishes cooperation between the Union and its Member States on training and education, in which a lifelong learning perspective is adopted in order to ensure the coherence of the various measures taken to promote education and training from childhood to adulthood. In this context, cooperation is voluntary, so actions at Union level should support and complement national actions. Education and training are important pillars for training as citizens and for the acquisition of professional skills necessary to integrate the labour market. Training and education also play a key role in realising Union policies, including the Europe 2020 strategy, the Digital Single Market, the European Agenda for Security and the Investment Plan for Europe.  In this regard, I am voting in the favourable sense, as I consider it crucial that Member States seek to make the most of this cooperation with a view to promoting lifelong learning and training as a decisive driver for economic and social development in the Union.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. Overall, it is a good report, which attempts to strike a balance between the work of this policy framework, which aims at recommendations for reforms of national education systems, and respect for national competence and the diversity of the cultures and needs of Member States. However, we can regret the "politically correctness" on migrants. I abstain on this text.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I abstained on this report, some of which clearly constituted a call for air to illegal immigration. Indeed, by asking to integrate migrants, who have not even been granted refugee status and are therefore illegal immigrants, in the various education and training programmes, this text suggests that we can welcome migrants in Europe with dignity, when in reality we are not able to provide them with housing, employment or the means to assimilate properly.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 I am very pleased to welcome this report, as education and training are a very important part of our daily lives. Unsurprisingly, it is precisely in this area that one of the most effective cooperations between Member States has emerged, which the report intends to make even more effective with various recommendations. The European Union has faced serious challenges as a result of the migrant crisis, which integration plays an essential role in addressing. I therefore particularly welcome the refugee part of the report, because integration starts with education.  I also feel it is necessary to stress that education is a tool that also ensures the future of the European Union, as it can promote active citizenship through appropriate programmes and help to acquire the fundamental values of the EU. In Slovakia, for example, low turnout in elections is a persistent problem, one of the main causes of which is that a significant proportion of the population still sees the European Parliament as the place in far-flu si'an Brussels from which adverse decisions come from.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ Education and Training 2020 (ET2020) is the framework for cooperation in education and training. It is a forum for exchanges of best practice, mutual learning and the gathering and dissemination of information and evidence of what works, as well as advice and support for policy reforms. I voted for this report, which will put in place at national and European levels, including within the ET2020 framework, education and training measures for adult asylum seekers who have recently arrived in Europe.

name: Norica NICOLAI
text: in writing. ‒ I support the conclusions presented in this report, reflecting the findings of the follow-up to the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (ET2020). Ensuring the quality of education and training, understood as encompassing formal, non-formal and informal systems, is now more necessary than ever in a context of high youth unemployment and further challenges. The follow-up to ET2020 indicates that significant problems persist with regard to quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination in education and training. Better coordination, both at European and at national level, needs to be achieved. This should include measures such as the extension of the work cycle from three to five years, the establishment of a new generation of ET2020 working groups, a strengthening of the steering role of informal bodies within ET2020, and the creation of an informal coordination body.

name: Luděk NIEDERMAYER
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the proposal to continue the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education. As education is a key area for the development of society, the Union's action in this area is very important. It is the lack of education that is responsible for many of the problems plaguing contemporary society – especially xenophobia and radicalism. I very much appreciate that the proposal honestly reflects the problems that the European education system has and provides answers that can contribute to addressing them. I welcome, for example, the efforts to involve experts from different fields in working groups, which will allow proposals to be come up that can lead to a broader concept of education.

name: Liadh NÍ RIADA
text: in writing. – This report was concerned with European cooperation in education and training. While there were some progressive provisions, particularly those which addressed the need to include refugees and migrants in the education system, the report contained instructions on harmonising national education and training systems, and that runs contrary to the principle of subsidiarity. Sinn Féin is committed to ensuring that the principle of subsidiarity is respected and strengthened at national level. In everyday language, subsidiarity means that decisions should be made at the lowest level possible, i.e. at the level of power that should take action. Erosion or breaches of the principle of subsidiarity can lead to unintended consequences – undermining, for example, citizens’ faith in the European Union – and should, therefore, be avoided. Whilst the report contained some progressive elements, these failed to mitigate the erosion of the principle of subsidiarity, and I therefore voted against it.

name: Andrey NOVAKOV
text: in writing. \u2012 The report notes that education should contribute to the personal development and growth of young people in order to make them proactive, responsible and knowledgeable, with civic, social, intercultural competences, as well as qualified professionals. 0000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 00 The report calls for greater involvement of all relevant stakeholders in the work of the EDUCATION 2020 strategic framework and encourages Member States to take full advantage of the potential provided by digitalisation, ICT and new technologies. The importance of teaching and learning common basic skills such as ICT, mathematics, critical thinking, foreign languages, mobility, etc., which would help young people adapt more easily to a changing social and economic environment is underlined. I am voting in favour of the proposed resolution.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. I voted against this report because it contains a lot of points that loopholes from non-Europeans to European education systems. There is no support for the transfer of national competences of our education systems to the EU.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the report submitted.  Education and training are important in helping people acquire the knowledge and professional skills they need to become competitive and resourceful workers. I believe that investing in pre-school education and care, having adapted them appropriately to the level of sensitivity and maturity of each target group, would bring a higher return than investment at any other stage of education.   In addition, the proper implementation of the measures envisaged will prevent the outflow of highly qualified minds. Particular attention must be paid to the general system of recognition of qualifications and diplomas.  The success of education at all levels depends on the good training of teachers and their continued desire to improve in their field, so this strategic framework will also allow sufficient investment in teacher training. It is also essential that the work of ET 2020 includes parents' associations and that good practices for cooperation between schools and families are encouraged.

name: Kostas PAPADAKIS
text: Writing. \u2012 The EU's known objectives for education serving the Europe 2020 strategy, i.e. the profits of monopolies, reiterated the resolution on "implementation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training (EC2020)".  The resolution promotes 'lifelong learning' and the continuous acquisition of 'appropriate and high quality skills and competences' 'promoting employability', i.e. fragmentation of knowledge, in order to adapt workers to the needs of business groups for specific skills over a specific period of time. The Bologna Treaty, which was the beginning of a series of reactionary changes in universities, is being praised. The perception that permeates the resolution is that education is a commodity. Grassroots families, young workers should put their hand in their pockets and, if they don't, resort to scholarships, but also to .... loans as proposed.  For these reasons, the European Parliamentary Group of the Communist Party of Greece voted against this resolution.  With respect to the education of refugees - although the general direction of the resolution is part of the logic of supporting the competitiveness of businesses - the JRC voted for those proposals which give even a little relief to the immediate problem of educating the children of refugees who are still in the air.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 In order to have people with high work skills, development in education and training must be supported. Similarly, the recognition of the importance of training educators underlines the key role they play in the learning process.  Unfortunately, there is still a very high level of unemployment in Europe, especially among young graduates. Then consider the recent refugee crisis, which has brought out new challenges, as education is to be considered the key to ensuring that the aforementioned actors can integrate into the host community.  It is up to EU policy and the actions of individual states to address the challenges of education and training. Noting that what is set out in the document is relevant to what is actually produced, I can vote in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ The right to education is one of the important human rights that develops man and his abilities in all segments, enriches him, opens and broadens horizons, creates the basis for a more prosperous life and is a value in itself. That is why I supported the Follow-Up Report on the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation on Education and Training. We need to make further efforts to give every child access to education, and it must be based not only on the technical transfer of knowledge, but on the transfer of values and the creation of responsible citizens who will contribute with their knowledge to the betterment of their country and the European Union. In doing so, it is important that the independence of each Member State is respected and that educational curricula remain within the competence of national educational legislation, so that they can nurture their history, culture and national values through them.  Education must not be spared because it ensures a better future for us, so we need to make the utmost efforts to ensure sufficient funding for a quality education system from an early age, preschool age. As much as possible, the benefits of mobility and international cooperation during education, which allows all Member States to be a member of the European Union and which creates new experiences and enriches each other nationally, should also be encouraged.

name: Pina PICIERNO
text: in writing. \u2012 Education and training are key to providing citizens with the knowledge and professional skills needed to become competitive and innovative workers. Not only that, they play a very important role in training open human beings and responsible citizens. It is therefore a good thing that IF 2020 has included social cohesion, equality, non-discrimination and civic skills as one of its objectives, on an equal footing with employment needs. The transposition by the Commission and the Council of the recommendations that emerged during the overall evaluation of the IF 2020 framework will make it possible to increase its effectiveness. In addition to defining the mandates of the new generation of working groups, the role of informal governance bodies is enhanced and feedback loops are established to improve communication between the different levels. The inclusion of support for educators as one of the programme's priorities is also very positive, and particular attention is paid to the needs of the most disadvantaged students, such as those belonging to ethnic or religious minorities, children from low-income families or the children of immigrants. A major challenge for national systems will also be to contribute to the integration of the many refugees who have recently arrived. I welcome the work done on IF 2020 and therefore vote in favour.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ I believe that education and training should not only focus on meeting labour market needs, but should be a value in itself, given that education plays an equally important role in developing ethical and civic virtues and humanistic values broadly, set out in the Treaties, and in strengthening the democratic principles underpinning Europe. Education should contribute to the personal development, mutual respect and growth of young people in order to make them proactive, responsible and aware citizens with civic, social and intercultural cross-sectoral competences and qualified professionals. I also believe that education should be considered as a fundamental human right and a public good that should be available to everyone. I welcome the ET 2020 Scoreboard and emphasise the need to take account of its conclusions and implement them without delay in order to increase added value and optimise the effectiveness of the framework, which will strengthen the importance for each country and mutual learning. On the other hand, I regret that major problems in terms of quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination in the field of education have not yet been addressed and I believe that more ambitious, coherent and effective policy measures need to be taken at European and national level.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 Education and training are important in helping people acquire the knowledge and professional skills they need to become competitive and innovative workers. These elements could also play an important role in training curious and responsible European citizens, with a strong sense of identity, a deep knowledge of their culture and common heritage capable of recognising and safeguarding European shared values. We should welcome the fact that the Paris Declaration of Education Ministers of 17 March 2015 was reflected in the joint report. I voted in favour because I believe that education, together with culture, is the key to promoting integration and promoting employment.

name: Tomasz Piotr PORĘBA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. "Education and training is important because it helps people acquire the professional knowledge and qualifications they need to become competitive and innovative employees. Moreover, education and training can play an important role in educating people with broad horizons, sensitive and inquisitive, as well as responsible citizens with a strong sense of identity, a thorough knowledge of their own culture and heritage. The aim of the report is to step up cooperation between working groups and directorates-general or high-level groups, to define mandates for the next generation of working groups, to define the structure of their work and the results to be achieved. It is important to involve more independent experts in the field of education. A close dialogue between the Commission, Member States and education stakeholders is necessary to ensure real follow-up to the recommendations made, to focus on improving the quality of education at all levels with a view to designating teacher education providers as one of et 2020's new priority areas. Much attention has been paid to the needs of different categories of learners, such as people from ethnic or religious minorities, poor children or children with migrant backgrounds. I hereby supported the report.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. Each country in the European Union is responsible for its education and training system. At the European level, the "Education and Training 2020" strategic framework helps to define the lines of cooperation between states to support national actions and help address common challenges, such as the ageing of our societies, the lack of skilled labour in certain sectors and the impact of technological developments. I voted in favour of this text, which makes recommendations to increase the technical effectiveness of this European cooperation.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. Education and training are essential to enable citizens to acquire professional skills and knowledge necessary to integrate into an increasingly competitive and innovative labour market, fostering a sense of identity and a culture based on respect for common European values. In a context where youth unemployment rates remain at worrying levels and where demographic challenges arising, among other factors, from the current migration crisis, call into account today's education and training systems in the European Union, the balance of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training "ET 2020", carried out by the Commission in cooperation with member states in cooperation with Member States , presents, in my view, an extraordinary relevance.  In this area, the document emphasises the role of parents and the need to develop positive parenting, as well as the role of educators in the integration of migrants, as well as in solving problems caused by the harmonisation of European educational practices.  Education is crucial for integration and employability. We therefore need new measures at national and European level aimed at improving education systems and considering the importance of training and education for adult asylum seekers and their children. I vote in favor.

name: Frédérique RIES
text: In writing. Strengthening cooperation at European level in the field of education, training and innovation is one of the priorities of the European Parliament, which voted this lunchtime in favour of the Krasnod-bski report complementing the "Education and Training 2020" (ET2020) strategic framework.  ET2020 aims to facilitate the learning and mobility of European citizens. It also seeks to improve the quality and effectiveness of school training and promote equity, social cohesion and active citizenship.  These measures are expected to address the major challenges of the coming years, such as an ageing population, a lack of skilled labour and the race for innovation in a context of global competition. ET2020's education goals are multiple. There is a desire to increase the number of children integrated into pre-school education to 95%, as well as a significant reduction in the proportion of young people with insufficient literacy, math and science skills.  In terms of training, the stated target of targeting at least 40% of people in the 30-34 age group with higher education and more generally 18-34 year olds in study or training abroad.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. The strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training has been reviewed by the Council and the European Parliament in order to strengthen its effectiveness, reorder priority areas of action and increase their added value. This report, which I have supported, highlights the need to achieve long-term goals while working on specific issues of relevance to each country such as a low level in adult learning, school dropout, social inclusion or gender gap, among others. Thanks to the S&D, the need to focus on social inclusion in order to achieve the ET2020 objectives, improve the inclusion and quality of education and training systems with a perspective of lifelong learning and call for better governance and cooperation in this area has been included. Emphasis is also placed on strengthening digital skills, high-quality early childhood education and inclusive education to ensure equal access and opportunities for all, especially for the most vulnerable groups, while including a specific chapter on migration and education, calling for the proper integration of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers into education and training systems.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. With Europe's youth unemployment rate at its highest, it is crucial to evaluate the EU ET2020 framework with the aim of increasing its added value and maximising its effectiveness. The Commission's assessment in 2014 led to the adoption by the Commission and the Council of a series of recommendations aimed at addressing the complexity of the context in which the ET2020 and its governance are based: defining the mandates of the new generation of working groups, mobilising independent experts, closer dialogue, consultation and coordination more regularly between the Commission. Member States and education stakeholders. Today's resolution contains a range of policy priorities and recommendations, including on the governance and coordination of ET2020 at all levels (for example, the Commission should open the new working groups to representatives of the various stakeholders and the fruits of their work be disseminated more widely available at all levels), but also on quality education (for example, , the achievement of the benchmark objectives for teaching and training should not be at the expense of quality, etc.)

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 Education and training should not be merely a means of meeting the needs of the labour market. It should be valuable in itself: education is equally important in shaping moral and civic virtues and, in a broad sense, humanist values enshrined in the Treaties, as well as in strengthening the democratic principles on which the European Union is founded. Therefore, the report on the situation of cooperation in training and education – et 2020 – is important, above all, as an insight into what kind of Europe we want to see in the future. I welcome the statement that education must promote the personal development, mutual respect and growth of young people, and that education itself should be seen as a fundamental human right and a public good that is accessible to all. At the same time, it is gratifying that the report highlights the different experiences of the Member States in this area, as well as the need for lifelong learning. The ET 2020 programme itself can only be viewed positively. Despite the fact that, in the field of education and training, the huge problems of quality, accessibility and discrimination on grounds of socio-economic status remain unresolved, the report identifies the most important directions for how Member States can and should improve both the education and training processes themselves and their cooperation.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. The 2020 strategic framework for education and training 2020 was taken into account in 2014 and recommendations were considered to increase the added value of the framework and optimise its effectiveness.  Although over the last decade there has been an increase in the number of people attending formal education, Europe has unfortunately recorded unprecedented levels of youth unemployment, affecting all levels of training, including young graduates. Efforts to cultivate the knowledge economy and promote social inclusion were reflected in the great twofold objective of the Europe 2020 strategy: to set a minimum threshold for education level and to increase participation at higher education levels. Education and training are important for the acquisition of professional skills and knowledge necessary for the training of motivated and accomplished workers. I voted in favour of this report because I recognise the importance that these policies play in the formation of active and responsible citizenship.

name: Tokia SAÏFI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which takes stock and makes recommendations on the implementation of the 2020 Strategic Framework for Education and Training (ET2020). Inclusive and quality education and training are essential for Europe's cultural, economic and social development. In this sense, this report calls for more ambitious, coordinated and effective political action in the fields of education and training, both at European and national level.  In order to improve the quality of education and training, this text calls for the emergence of good practices to assess qualitative progress, in addition to the benchmarks and benchmarks used in the ET2020 framework.  It is crucial that Member States invest in inclusive education that addresses societal issues in order to ensure equal access and opportunities for all.  In this sense, this text also takes into account the issue of the current refugee crisis.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on rationalisation within the framework of European cooperation in the field of education and training. Although education is an exclusive competence of the Member States, the European Union intervenes in the face of the challenges common to national training and education systems, and it is precisely in order to respond to these challenges that the IF 2020 strategy has been formulated.  Specifically, IF 2020 consists of a forum involving actors of a different nature, from European Commission officials to representatives of civil society, who exchange information on good practices, winning solutions, and advice. In 2014, the Commission carried out an assessment of the existing framework, identifying the weaknesses and solutions to be made, which are the subject of the text voted on in plenary.  The importance of IF 2020 and more generally of European education programmes is crucial for the future of our children: more and more students are participating in European mobility programmes by acquiring knowledge and skills that give an important advantage in the labour market, as numerous sector research has shown.  These experiences are not limited to enriching the curriculum, but allow young people to fully experience European citizenship, representing a moment of unparalleled growth.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. In 2014, the Commission took stock of the education and training strategy, ET 2020, in cooperation with Member States. On the basis of the conclusions of the resulting report, the Commission set priorities for the period 2016–2020. While these priorities address unquestionable aspects such as inclusive education, equality, equity, non-discrimination, civic competences, well-being, social cohesion, intercultural dialogue, innovation and support for teaching, they remain a wrap with which to prestige a neoliberal conception of education and training. The Krasnodebski report, in line with the Commission, does not hide the conversion of education and training into business, and guides them to employability rather than knowledge development. It is necessary to recognize the inclusion in the report of aspects such as the reception in this area of migrants, refugees and asylum seekers, as well as the gender perspective. However, these necessary inclusions should not pay the toll on the commodization of education; that's why we voted against it.

name: Sven SCHULZE
text: Writing. I voted in favour of the "Report on the follow-up to the Strategic Framework for European Cooperation in Education and Training (ET 2020)", as the adaptation of the European framework ET 2020 to current circumstances is very important. ET 2020 is the European support programme for education and training. Especially with the still high level of youth unemployment in many countries, it is important to constantly adapt our programme in such a way that it delivers the greatest possible benefit to all.

name: Olga SEHNALOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 Education and training are an important but not the only prerequisite for employment in the labour market and for social inclusion. Promoting equal access to lifelong learning for all is therefore important. I therefore welcome the evaluation of the Strategic Framework for Education and Training 2020 and agree that it should be reformed to be more in line with practice and to take into account recommendations from the parties' experience to date.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The Strategic Framework is a multiannual plan related to the objectives of the Europe 2020 Strategy that aims to increase student mobility, equity, cohesion and active citizenship, as well as an approach to "creativity and innovation, including entrepreneurship". The results of recent years show that the mercantilist orientation of the education system, the standardization of educational programmes to increase competitiveness between pupils and centres, as well as the cuts in austerity programmes implemented in economies such as Spain, have led to an obvious imbalance between the very objectives set by the Commission and the Council, which no longer represent my position in favour of free and quality public education. This adopted resolution, which assesses a joint report by the Commission and the Council, seeks to legitimize these practices through Parliament, adding minor positive nuances (e.g. by calling for promoting multidisciplinary and adapted training of teachers in the face of new social challenges, or the review of evaluation working groups). That is why, since the report does not address the fundamental problems that lead to an increase in social inequalities, I voted against it.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report stresses the need for and importance of interaction and cooperation between Member States in the field of education and training. The ET2020 programme supports the education and training system of each individual Member State and has four objectives: to promote mobility for educational purposes, to improve the quality and effectiveness of institutions and training, to promote social cohesion and active citizenship and to encourage creativity and innovation of the entrepreneurial spirit. The Erasmus mobility programme is, for example, a great achievement of ET2020: in fact, in 2013-2014 alone, it enabled 272 000 students and 57 500 operators to benefit from cultural and training experiences in different European institutions. In the hope that European cooperation in this area will continue, I have chosen to vote in favour of this report.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 Education and training are essential in developing ethical and civic values and the universally understood values enshrined in the Treaties, as well as in consolidating the democratic principles on which Europe is founded. While there has been an improvement in results related to the achievement of higher education targets under ET 2020, there are reports of concerns about the effectiveness of Member States' investment in education. They are concerned about the current risks associated with the onset of radicalisation, violence, bullying and behavioural problems that are already starting at primary school level. As a former teaching staff member, he is concerned that there are still huge problems in the field of education and training, particularly in terms of quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination. I supported the resolution because I believe that, thanks to the proposed measures, we will be able to eliminate the current low level of knowledge and basic skills. In order to achieve the ET 2020 strategic framework and the education system, I expect Member States to strengthen links between higher education and vocational education and training institutions, research institutes and the economic sector.

name: Michaela ŠOJDROVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the European Parliament's report on the continuation of the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training (ET 2020). I was shadow rapporteur for this report for the PPE and I agree with its resulting form. I'm glad it was accepted by such a large majority. In the final vote, some controversial points against mobility and the Bologna process were ousted, which I consider to be important and beneficial aspects of EU education policy. The report fully respects the fact that education is primarily in the hands of the Member States. However, a framework is expected from the EU level for skills, inclusive education and reducing radicalisation, as well as recommendations for convergence between education and the labour market in order to reduce youth unemployment. On the other hand, the report rightly emphasises that education is a value in itself and not just a fulfilment of the needs of the labour market. In this context, I managed to put emphasis on ethical and personality education, as well as emphasis on the irreplaceable role of parents in the process of education and communication with schools. It is good that the report positively assesses the EU's actions to support teachers, including the use of Erasmus+. Overall, the report accentuates the quality of education before quantity and does not forget the need to integrate refugee and migrant children into the education system.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: Writing. Over the past decade, there has been a sharp increase in the number of people entering formal education, while Europe is suffering from an unprecedented level of youth unemployment, which also affects graduates. Between 2011 and 2014, the average unemployment rate in the EU increased the most among young people. The report on the further consideration of the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training is divided into three parts, the strategic framework, the quality of education and training and migration and education. In this way, the report does not take into account the main challenges in the field of education and training in Europe, as it does not follow a comprehensive approach. What is more, despite the fact that the whole chapter is devoted to migration and education, does not even touch on the challenges associated with refugees. In addition, the report misses a stronger link between education, entrepreneurship and research, as well as the involvement of social partners and civil society. Although the report stresses that education is good for personal and, consequently, social growth above economic well-being, I believe that the recommendations are rather unbalanced and promote a traditional view of society. On the basis of the above, I do not believe that the report contributes to the further development of the 2020 agenda, which is why I voted against the report.

name: Joachim STARBATTY
text: Writing. The own-initiative report analyses the strategic framework of "Education and Training 2020".  Each EU country is responsible for its own education and training systems, as this is not a core competence of the EU. The role of EU policies is to support national actions and help address common challenges. This report is basically about evaluating the Education and Training 2020 framework and making recommendations at the level of cooperation, quality and efficiency. Countries receive advice and support for political reforms. The ALFA agrees with the core content of this report and supports a large number of the improvements mentioned in the report. All that should be mentioned here are better communication, better quality of education, support and further development of teachers, recognition of qualifications and integration of migrants entitled to reside in our education systems. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report. However, if the European Commission were to launch a draft law on this matter in the future, I will weigh much more critically whether this is not an attempt to impose common rules on the Member States.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: Writing. \u2012 The quality of education and the desire to learn are also behind the challenges facing Europe on a daily basis. ET 2020 should bring us better integration in education in the future, which is key to reducing unemployment.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ Due to the wave of migration that is constantly bringing new families to the EU, there has been a need to re-evaluate the education system called ET 2020. The Culture and Education Committee report alludes to segments of education and training that need to be closely analysed to create the most effective integration of migrants. As the institution of the family is a fundamental pillar of society, it is very important to involve parent associations in the et 2020 framework and to encourage the exchange of examples of good practice in schools. Given that transparency is the cornerstone of any successful democracy, the Committee considers it essential that the results of the new working cycle of European and national initiatives in the field of training and education are shared with the public.  The achievement of certain criteria in the completed level of education should therefore be accompanied by a strong focus on improving the quality of education at all levels. Measures are needed at national and European level, i.e. under ET 2020, in the field of education and training for adult asylum seekers who have arrived in Europe. The report should, inter alia, single out support for teachers in further qualification efforts, as it is necessary to have professional teachers who are familiar with the latest changes in education. I support this report because I think education is key to integration and employment, because unless a formula is found for the necessary changes, social differences are likely to deepen.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. —Education must be considered a fundamental human right and a public good that should be available to all. Education should contribute to the personal development, mutual respect and growth of young people so that they become proactive, responsible and aware citizens. Also, quality education and training are a source of sustainable growth, but they also contribute to European Union strategies and initiatives such as Europe 2020, the Digital Single Market Initiative, the European Agenda on Security, etc. The importance of digital skills that are essential should be highlighted, as by adopting these skills young people are ready for the 21st century. Students of all ages and in all forms of education themselves must be encouraged to actively participate in the management of their educational structures. I support this report because I believe that education and training should not only focus on meeting labour market needs, but should be a value in itself, as education plays an important role in the development of civic virtues and humanistic values, as well as in strengthening the democratic principles on which the European Union is founded.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the further consideration of the strategic framework for European cooperation in education and training. Education and training should be a value in itself, not aimed only at meeting labour market needs. I agree with the report, which welcomes the ET 2020 scoreboard, while stressing that the conclusions of this review must be taken into account and implemented without delay in order to increase the added value of the framework and optimise its effectiveness and to strengthen relevance for each country and mutual learning. I also agree that very major problems in the field of education and training are still not solved in terms of quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 This report unfortunately moves to the logic that education must serve the needs of the market. In other words, it is moving in the opposite direction from the educational character - the democratic and human - that we envision. As a result, instead of promoting proposals to improve the quality of education, its commercialisation is being promoted with a view to creating a flexible workforce, which will have training and can be constantly changed to meet the needs of the market. That is why we voted against the report.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Education in addition to providing knowledge to young people should focus on their education and education while respecting human values, morals, ethics and the specificities of nations on a case-by-case basis. Flattening, absolute equalisation and poorly understood multiculturalism and diversity do not lead to the education of young people.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the adoption of the report on the follow-up to the strategic framework for European cooperation in the field of education and training, as, in addition to highlighting the achievements of the work carried out so far in the framework of Education and Training 2020, it rightly highlights the further opportunities and challenges we face in the field of education and training. I agree with the report's finding that there are still huge problems in quality, accessibility and socio-economic discrimination in education and training, and that ambitious, coordinated and effective policy measures should therefore be developed, both at European and national level.  I also share the reporter's concern about increasing radicalisation, violence, abuse and behavioural problems, which are already appearing at the level of primary education. It would therefore be really useful for the Commission to carry out research on this at EU level, examining the response of Member States to such trends.

name: Adam SZEJNFELD
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 European cooperation in education and training, which was adopted in 2008, is voluntary. This strategy takes the perspective of lifelong learning to ensure consistent education and training in all phases of life, from early childhood to old age. ET 2020, in addition to highlighting lifelong learning strategies, emphasises the promotion of equality, social inclusion, innovation, creativity and entrepreneurship for Europeans.  Statistics show that 8 years after et 2020 approval, some progress has been made, but not in all areas. At present, the level of employment of people immediately after university is particularly problematic.  The European Parliament's report properly highlightes the existing problems with the implementation of the strategy and points to the need for further action by EU Member States to improve cooperation in the field of education and training. That is why I have chosen to vote in favour of this document.

name: Claudiu Ciprian TĂNĂSESCU
text: in writing. \u2012 Social inclusion plays a key role in achieving ET2020 objectives.
